Reviews.Content: This place... I can't go anywhere else for Ramen.  The food is always good.  Service is a little overwhelmed, but usually awesome.  Its like stepping into Japan, and then eating it! *Godzilla Roar*

Reviews.Author: Pat
Reviews.Content: Real Japanese food made by real Japanese people! So yes they are added to my safe to eat Japanese food list in Vegas BUT with all of the new ramen-yas that have popped up over the past year I would be hard pressed to come back here after our first and only experience here...   I know this is a harsh statement but I have good reasoning! So hear me out my faithful followers. Trust me I wanted to love this place...  Me and the gf came here late one night. We were the only patrons I the joint.  I ordered karaage and Kim chee for starters, a bowl or shoyu ramen and the gf  got miso ramen.   The karaage was on point! I put my seal of approval on it as being legit Japanese.  The same can be said for the Kim chee. For those who eat Kim chee on the regular can tell the difference between the Korean and Japanese subtle of Kim chee so kudos for that!  All was fine until the ramen.  First off it took 15+ minutes for us to get it after we finished the karaage (keep in mind we are the only people in the place)  Girlfriends bowl comes out first and is a proper bowl of miso ramen. She is nice enough give me a taste while i wait. Noodles maintained a little firmness, the broth a little sweet but still rich and flavorful. All that was missing was a little pat of butter (eh don't knock it until you try it!) So I figure the same nomness can be expected in my bowl... Nope! I got soggy skinny tan tan mein noodles in my shoyu ramen. The error many have gone unnoticed by the unassuming gaigin (white person) whose only comparison is top ramen. But to a Japanese person this was a blatantly obvious  screw job.  It was like they gave me noodles from another order or screwed up my order and said he'll never know.. So sad to say I had a sad bowl of ramen. I think that they knew they screwed up because we were not checked on by the waitress till we were both almost done with our bowls. By that point the noodles would be soggy anyways. No point in crying over soggy noodles right? (Ancient Chinese Proverb) I quickly paid the check and bounced...   Maybe it was a fluke but it should not have been done and for that I have to say I will not be back...

Reviews.Author: Wendy
Reviews.Content: Best ramen in Las Vegas! I liked Monta ramen but I thought the broth was tastier here. The Char Siu rice bowl is a yummy side as well. Just wished it was closer to the strip.

Reviews.Author: Manami
Reviews.Content: I frequent Ramen Sora for my ramen fix but decided to try Fukumimi Ramen for Saturday lunch. They were rated the best ramen place on Las Vegas Japan Times and I can see why this place is rated #1 in Vegas.   SERVICE Attentive and quick. Water was filled the entire time and short wait time! 2 thumbs up.  FOOD I got their Kogashi Ramen. It's one of their Tonkotsu soup base option and is topped with fragrant garlic oil/fried onion. Broth was all black like squid ink and oh em gee...I loved it. Broth was extremely hot (just the way I like it in the cold weather), super flavorful and I loved their thin noodle. Chashu was next level...so tender. One slice of chashu kept me wanting more. They got everything on point.   I also got their Soboro Bowl. Soboro wasn't flaky/dry like other places. The sweet sauce from soboro went perfectly with their white rice. I got their mini size but it was still a good portion.   CONCLUSION Their tonkotsu is flavorful and assari/light. I don't know why Monta is so popular, Fukumimi is much better in my opinion.

Reviews.Author: B
Reviews.Content: i have been here 3 or 4 times. Always terrific. The prices are great. 2 people can eat there with 2 bowls 2 starters, and a couple of sodas for 28 $.  The garlic chicken is stupid good. I always go for the spicy tonkotsu. Really a true gem in a not so known area.

Reviews.Author: Kyra
Reviews.Content: Kind of disappointed honestly. I was really looking forward to some multi-dimensional ramen! Not worth $8 per bowl in my opinion. It would't be hard to do it better at home for less than half that price. The noodles were undercooked and the broth was lack-luster. My husband's spicy ramen broth was good and the salad was OK. Asked for a glass of water, never got it. It also bothered me that they turned several people away starting at 10:30pm when they advertise their hours until 11pm. Our check was brought over while we were still eating and we were bugged every three minutes after that. I don't like feeling rushed, especially when they aren't scheduled to close for another 20 minutes. Maybe my ramen sucked because they were trying to close early or something. Either way, not cool. I may give it a second chance at some point in the distant future.

Reviews.Author: H
Reviews.Content: The best ramen and karage in town. Their pot stickers/gyoza are very good as well.....perfect during the winter.

Reviews.Author: Hannah
Reviews.Content: Tried tan tan men for the first time. I never had it before so I had no idea what to expect. The broth is thick spicy and sweet. A lot of sesame flavor too. If you dont like sweet flavors,  I don't recommend tan tan men. I like their regular spicy tonkotsu and other ramen though.. Just not tan tan broth..  I go to Fukumimi ramen often because it is close to where I live.  However, I cannot say it is the best ramen in town.  The broth seems too oily sometimes and it is difficult to drink the broth which should be the best part..

Reviews.Author: Chang
Reviews.Content: Don't see what the hype is about.   Service slow, had to ask for our water several times. Appetizers were served after ramen was served, and in my opinion it wasn't all that. I've had better.   The ramen broth was not rich enough and the meat didn't have a great texture. Everything was overly salty, even the egg in the ramen. I'm not wowed.

Reviews.Author: Tiana
Reviews.Content: This place is good. The chicken Karaage was delicious and reasonably priced at $3.90 and came with a little salad. My boyfriend and I both ordered the Tantan Men, wish it came with an egg, but you can add it for a buck I think . My sister had the chicken ramen, the only ramen she could eat because that doesn't have pork. Food was out fast. Nice small place. Next door is a Basken Robbins so you can have ice cream after like we did!

Reviews.Author: Alyssa
Reviews.Content: My favorite ramen on the Eastside! So glad I don't have to go all the way to Chinatown to get some great ramen. Our server is always so nice and sweet & she practically knows me already! My favorite is the Fukumimi Ramen with thick noodles and extra egg! YUMMMMM!

Reviews.Author: Roberta
Reviews.Content: Great little find. Would definitely return. Portions are just right, staff friendly and part inexpensive.

Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: Great ramen in Vegas is actually hard to come by but Fukumimi produces a very good product.  I've tried almost everything on their menu without any disappointment.  Their two chicken karaage options, gyoza, and agedashi tofu are the appetizers I would recommend.  All come fairly quickly when ordered, cooked perfectly, and taste great.  I've tried their extra fragrant garlic oil ramen soup, their tantanmen, and various additional types of ramen that they offer here.  All offer that 'just what the doctor ordered' feeling once you taste that first sip.  The star of the shop is none other than their Fukumimi Ramen, a pork-based ramen with thin noodles, seaweed, boiled egg, and an ample amount of pork chashu.  Other additions come with a small charge but may be worth it if you like such items as added corn, extra egg, extra chashu, or bamboo sprouts.  The broth is rich and salty but not over-the-top.  It's definitely soothing to the soul on a cold night but contagiously good that I would even eat it on a hot summer's day.    I have even ordered to-go for work for myself and all my work colleagues.   The noodles come separately with the pork belly on top and a separate styrofoam container contains the hot broth ready to be poured onto the noodles.  The soup remains just as delicious as ever.    Service is usually fast, despite the somewhat small and packed establishment.  There's usually an available table in minutes which you cannot say true for places like either Monta location.   Definitely order the Fukumimi if you hadn't had the chance to.  Being a stickler for good ramen, and having had some of the best that California and New York have to offer, I think Las Vegas's Fukumimi ramen can hang with the best of them.  Yelp 100 Challenge 2016 - 7/100

Reviews.Author: Rod
Reviews.Content: Quality ramen with a twist.  A newcomer to the ramen scene.  This time on the East side.  Ain't nothing wrong with that.  Noodles - hardly seasoned but chewy.  Check. Chashu - tender porky goodness.  Check. Salt, soy, miso, spicy broths.  Check, check, check, check. Ramen that showcases it all - very flavorful  Fukumimi  (tonkotsu topped with everything).  Check.  So what sets it apart from the big boys, Sora and Monta?  Tantan Men; a simple, almost naked bowl of noodles swimming in an exceptional spicy sesame broth.   The broth is so intense, you can't see the noodles through its mustard yellow liquid.  Tender baby bok choi breaks the one dimensional texture.  Thanks you Godzilla X for bringing this elixir to my attention.   PC Tip:  While manners dictate you should drink all the ramen broth,  those with a weak constitution or first time connoisseurs should make an exception for very rich and spicy tantan men.   Just sayin.  Excellent chicken karaage (crisp with the hint of ginger flavor).  Good curry rice (strong with bits of tender pork).  NO GYOZA.  NO TONKATSU.  A very worthy addition to Vegas' ramen scene.

Reviews.Author: Luisa
Reviews.Content: Having spent a few years in Japan roaming the streets looking for good eats. Ramen houses were always the best with no need for trying to understand the kanji menus as a rockie. When I came across this place serving tan tan mein noodles I went bizarre about wanting to try some. I came during lunch time on a weekday and it was pretty packed so I took that as a great sign. The place is on the smaller side but it made me feel at home in Japan even with the modern design. I sat on a tiny two person table towards the wall. When the nice pretty asian lady came to take my order it was a big dissapointment from the start. I was in the middle of ordering and the table next to me began speaking to her in her native tongue and she straight up left me with the words in my mouth to get them sodas. Kind of rude I would say! I asked for an order of gioza and they told me they did not have any! WHAT? Why have it on the menu if you do not serve it, let alone carry it? You can not eat ramen and not accompany it with gioza! So I ordered tan tan mein noodles with much anticipation. When my bowl arrived, the bowl looked liked they had poured milk in it. The noodles were creamy?!?! Real tan tan mein noodles are composed of a spicy broth not a spicy milky broth like if it was curry. I understand there are many versions on how to make tan tan mein but this one was wayyyyy too creamy The ground pork was alright but it did not have great consistency, it was a bit like sand in my opinion. I'm on a tan tan mein fix so if anyone knows of a better place, please do tell.

Reviews.Author: Brooke
Reviews.Content: This restaurant has a focused menu - ramen and rice bowls - and everything is delicious! There are also a few appetizers and the kimchi tofu app is absolutely heavenly. The soft tofu melts in your mouth and kimchi  spice offers a perfect counterbalance. Prices are right and the staff are always friendly!

Reviews.Author: Morison
Reviews.Content: Wanted a quick ramen fix when i was in Las Vegas, and this was close by. Pretty tiny restaurant. Pricing was around $8 for a bowl of ramen, which didn't really come with that much meat, or rather, it just came with one piece. Not really that worth it, but obviously, I'm from the San Gabriel Valley area, where Asian food is all over, so I have a more biased point of view. Soup base is ok here as well.

Reviews.Author: Brad
Reviews.Content: Whenever I'm on this side of town craving ramen I'll come here. I love the miso Tonkotsu ramen and Karaage. Staff and cooks are friendly.

Reviews.Author: Xyz
Reviews.Content: I have never seen any service that could be worse than Fukumimi. It is the old ulgy bitchy female server that just make me sick and will never come back again! At first  she basicaly just ask what do you want , threw the chopstick to our table and and the end, she stood by our table staring at us act like cant wait to get the check book and see how much you guys tipped!  Food is pretty good, noodle was not as good as Monta Ramen tho.

Reviews.Author: Yenny
Reviews.Content: 3.5 stars rounded up!  I've been wanting to explore the Vegas ramen scene a little more and landed on Fukumimi Ramen (from a friend's recommendation as well as Yelp reviews). Came here on a Sunday night for dinner and my friend and I were seated right away at the bar (the tables were all occupied)  FOOD: - karaage - good! Not too bready, served piping hot with a small salad and you dip it into their salt/pepper mix. We dipped it into the chili powder and that made it even yummier! - Fukumimi ramen - this was pretty good! Rich broth, but not too salty. Generous portions of noodles (on the thinner side, kinda soba-ish) - Tantan men (with an egg added) - rich, thick and creamy broth. The ground pork was sweet and savory at the same time and the noodles were more eggy and curly.  SERVICE: Can't complain! Seated right away, food came out hot and quick. Friendly smiles all around.   VENUE: Cute! Rather spacious for a ramen spot. Tables along the right side and counter seating on the left. Casual, relaxed vibe.  PARKING: Plenty! It's located in a HUGE plaza where most things are closed before dinner time so you'll have you pick of any spot you want.

Reviews.Author: Alexandra
Reviews.Content: We visited for the first time last week. Tried the deep fried tofu appetizer, tanmen noodles and curry chicken. All was very good. Service was quick and friendly. We did have one small issue- I tried to call to alert them, but they could never tell me when the manger or owner would be there specifically. All I will say (to the owner/workers), having a fan blowing into the dining area may not be the best plan. You never know what it will blow into the customer area....please take note.

Reviews.Author: Jack
Reviews.Content: Was back today,  The staff and chef are nice and accommodating.  Chicken Tori Ramen is best of all time. Karaage is among the best of anywhere.  Best Ramen place in Vegas!!!!!  Monta is #2  This a mammaluke free restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Vanessa
Reviews.Content: I really like this place! I prefer this place to Monta Ramen, which is also good, but the broth here is more to my liking. I've had their Tan Tan Men and their Spicy Miso which are both delicious! You won't leave disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Nikika
Reviews.Content: I love Fukumimi the Tankatsu Spicy Miso is so delish! Broth service & timing are on point. Can't go wrong here

Reviews.Author: Marie
Reviews.Content: I had the classic ramen with extra chashu and it definitely satisfied my craving for ramen :)

Reviews.Author: KJ
Reviews.Content: Love this place.. Everyone is very nice. I love the curry here, and my Mother loves the ramen. I will gladly drive from Downtown to eat here. After lunch, you can run to Walgreens just across the way.  How can you not like a place called Fukumimi?! Lol!

Reviews.Author: Christine
Reviews.Content: I'm giving all five partially for the food and mostly for the customer service.  I came in during lunch and even though I was a party of one, the staff offered me a table or the option to sit at the bar. Everyone was welcoming and the waitress took the time out of a busy lunch to hand me a menu and not rush me to take an order. I ordered my fair share, and all of it was on point. Chicken karaage was moist on the inside and crispy on the outside. The kimchi salad was done just right, and my chashu bowl was layered with equal portions of rice to meat. Although the place continued to get busy, the staff never rushed me out or made me feel uncomfortable.  A plus for such great service and for creating simple and delicious comfort food.

Reviews.Author: Chuck
Reviews.Content: Been to most of the ramen joints in Las Vegas. Fukumimis broth is to die for. Way better than Monta, Sora or Anime by far

Reviews.Author: Cassandra
Reviews.Content: After seeing so many great reviews and hearing great things about Fukumimi, my bf and I decided to give it a try. Ramen is one of our favorite dishes and we are always up for trying new places. We thought that maybe we would be able to find a new ramen spot. When we first looked at the menu we were surprised by the low prices, the lowest we've seen. Especially with it coming with corn and chashu?! We thought that was awesome. I ordered the Tonkatsu, miso ramen with nori (which our server didn't refer to as nori and seemed a bit confused until she realized it was seaweed).   After a short wait, and being served I realized why the prices were so low. The bowls are really small and they actually don't have much food in them at all. After my first sip of the broth, I was sadly let down. There was almost no flavor. In my entire bowl I maybe had about 10 kernels of corn and 1 piece of chashu. I wish I had known. I would've asked for extra and paid for the extra. My bf ordered the Kara-miso, spicy miso ramen and he was so disappointed. The broth tasted like hot sauce. He ordered the chashu bowl as well and was honestly more excited about that.  After finishing our food, we awkwardly waited for about 15 minutes for someone to come back and bring us our check. The new server even took the couple's order next to us, ignored me, took care of two other tables before she acknowledged me and brought us our check.   There is honestly nothing special here. The ramen tastes instant and I really hope the ramen in Japan has something better to offer than this place. We left feeling very unsatisfied.

Reviews.Author: Kati
Reviews.Content: As soon as we sat down, the waitress brought out bowl and children's  silverware for our toddler. Never in my time as a mother have I seen a restaurant offer that, I was very impressed.  The menu was small, simple and to the point. My husband ordered the tantan men and I got the tonkotsu soy. The pork belly was super tender and the broth was very flavorful. $18 for the two of us is amazing while on vacation. We would be regulars if we lived here.

Reviews.Author: Jess
Reviews.Content: Have came here numerous times. Close to UNLV. Food is most often pretty good, however , recently something seems off. Fukumimi Ramen, karragge , edamame, and honey karragge are what we usually get. Also service used to be pretty good but now seems to have dwindled just a bit. Just the waitresses not the cooks, cooks are always friendly! Still waaaaaassay better than Monta.  Would be nice if they were closer to Summerlin.

Reviews.Author: Shannon
Reviews.Content: Had the Tonkatsu miso ramen with egg, corn, bok choy, sprouts, and baked gyoza. Noodles were too thick. Not as flavorful as I would have liked. No mushrooms available which was disappointing. Gyoza was good. Wouldn't return. Other better ramen houses in Vegas.

Reviews.Author: Jade
Reviews.Content: It was a odd rainy day in the valley and a bit cool even. A cousin from out of town wanted soup and we were on this side of town near other family members.   They do shio, miso and tonkatsu, tantan men broth. They offer chicken broth based ramen for those who aren't down with the pork base. There are cold noodles salads, rice bowls and some appetizers as well.   I haven't had tantan men ramen in ages, but I used to be in love with it when I was a kid. It's a bit Chinese influenced ramen, with a chile sesame soup with ground meat, scallion, bok choy. If you like dan dan noodles, you probably would enjoy this. Fukumimi has a solid tantan-men with a good broth and nicely chewy noodles.   Mini chasu bowl was also good and for a  mini  it was a sizeable portion. The only thing is I thought it was going to be sliced chasu like what is in the ramen, which I think I prefer. Instead, it is shredded up pieces that seems to be mixed with a bit of soy.   I also tried a bite of my cousins karaage. It wasn't bad, but could have been a tad more crispy even though I enjoyed the flavor and texture overall.  The service was decent enough, my drink was refilled a few times throughout the meal.  The rest of my party was happy with their meals. I haven't tried the rest of their ramen offerings, but I'm happy to find a place that offers a solid tantan-men which is a variation that no other ramen shop makes in town.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: I am still thinking about Fukumimi over a month after my visit. I was really waffling over which ramen place to visit on my last trip to vegas because there are just so many that look good! I'm glad I decided on Fukumimi.... hidden in a creepy strip mall next to a closed down discount super market, Fukumimi is definitely nondescript. I was nervous walking in, but it's cute on the inside. My friend and I split their gyoza and I had their spicy ramen with corn. The gyoza were some of the best I've had.... not your typical frozen crappy gyoza you find at many Japanese restaurant... but really crispy flavorful dumplings, worth the money. The real star of the restaurant, however, is the ramen. My spicy ramen had a good heat level....a delicious gooey egg... sweet corn.... chewy noodles.... it was one of the best ramen bowls I have ever had. I ate almost the entire bowl (I seriously almost made myself sick...but so good!). The prices are reasonable and the food is top notch. Try it, you won't be sorry!

Reviews.Author: Shai
Reviews.Content: Not the best ramen I've ever tasted, but a nice stop for a cold night. Service was fast and staff was nice, generous portions and good prices.

Reviews.Author: Lea
Reviews.Content: My friends and I happened to be around the area and we were craving ramen. We yelped and found this place. It's a small restaurant but the seating was nice. It wasn't too crowded when we came in.   My friend ordered the Chicken Karaage and it was delicious. The drizzled mayo on top looked overwhelming but it wasn't surprisingly. Though, I felt that the chicken was undercooked due to it's chewy texture instead of firm. The batter helped with a crunch and overall we enjoyed it.  We also got a Chasu bowl, I have never tried one before but I found it tasteful.   Every time I try a Japanese restaurant I have to try their Agedashi Tofu. My favorite dashi sauce is at Ichiza in Chinatown but Fukumimi's Agedashi is coming up at number two. Two really good sized deep fried tofu pieces and their dashi sauce was not salty at all like some other places. FIVEEEEE STARS!!   As for the ramen, I got the Kogashi and my friends all got the Tonkatsu (Miso).   I was very pleased with the Kogashi. I don't even know how to describe it. It was perfectly salted and the broth was very good. The noodles were thin and that's how I like it although I didn't know there were bean sprouts, not fond, but I ate them anyways.  Overall, I really do like this place. I recommend trying it absolutely!

Reviews.Author: Stephen
Reviews.Content: First off i am a die hard Sora ramen fan. So when my wife wanted to go to Fukumimi i was skeptical at first. the place is small and atmosphere was nothing to note....like a typical japanese ramen house. I ordered the spicy miso ramen without reading the description on the menu (my fault). I didnt realize the ramen didnt come with nori and it had corn which im not a fan of in my ramen. The noodle were as good as the noodles at Sora nice and thick perfectly al dente. The spicy miso broth had alittle sweetness to it that i kind of disliked, but it was still delicious. Sora makes a much better spicy miso broth in my opinon. So why did i give them 5 stars you might ask? Their fukumimi ramen ( which my wife ordered ) was friggin delcious! The broth is super hearty and flavorful. I dont know if they have a spicy version of that soup but if they do im there. I highly recommend the fukumimi ramen. When im on the east side of town and i want Ramen Fukumimi's my spot!

Reviews.Author: Tyson
Reviews.Content: We had issues with the Japanese hostess/ waitress last night. Horrible country songs about pickup trucks and annoying commercials were playing from 102.7 FM radio. I asked the Japanese hostess/waitress if she would change the station. She replied,  it is just a radio.    Also, when she brought out the first bowl of ramen, she said,  spicy ramen.  My wife repeatedly asked her if it was spicy miso, or spicy tonkatsu. Her response was always,  spicy ramen.   :/-  UPDATE We have continued to eat here. The music is awesome now. No more country songs. Service is back to normal. There is a cute waitress there too. I am changing my review from one star back up to five stars.  Try the spicy miso. It is the best ramen they serve here.

Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: Excellent ramen in Las Vegas, just off the strip.  Nice to find  non-standard  Vegas fare to change things up from the buffets and burger joints.  Didn't try my standard shoyu ramen, but the tried the Tan-tan ramen, and that was quite tasty as was the karaage chicken.  Definitely recommend, and will return next time I'm in Vegas.

Reviews.Author: Tram
Reviews.Content: As far as a ramen place goes in town this place kicks everyone's booty by a mile.  It is waaaaayyyyyyyyy better than Anime Ramen.  The noodles are excellent quality, never tastes soggy, and I would almost say that it tastes like they make their own noodles.  But I'm not sure of that so I won't say it.  If you love noodles, it's an awesome place to go.  It is a bit pricey, considering it's ramen, but the servings are very generous so it makes up for that, and the fixings too.    I can't recommend one thing on the menu, it's all good, just depends on your mood.

Reviews.Author: Genevieve
Reviews.Content: Alright Fukumimi, you've officially stolen my heart. For the LOVE of ramen! I'm so glad my boyfriend and I visited Japan 2 weeks ago, I can now suggest to eat at a ramen place anywhere, and anytime! My boyfriend wasn't very  ramen-friendly  before our trip. But now I know he appreciates the taste and flavor of ramen soup!  Lets start with the atmosphere, this place is just so cozy! We came here during a rainy day, and of course...I was in need of a ramen fix. Soup always sounds good on a rainy day. It's very limited seating, but you never feel clustered or overpacked when you come here.   I ordered the fukumimi ramen which consisted of extra pork that was so soft once my teeth got a hold of the meat, seaweed (which I loved), an egg and the ramen noodles. May I add how flavorful the soup was? I felt like I was back in Tokyo! My boyfriend had the spicy miso ramen, which only had one pork meat (I ended up giving him a few of my pork meats, since I had a lot), an egg and the ramen noodles, but also had a spice on top. I got to try his, and if you're down for spicy- this will be good for your taste buds!   Gosh, I could seriously eat ramen everyday and not get tired of it. I'm so lucky that fukumimi is literally down the street from me, I can come here any day of the week! See you soon fukumimi!

Reviews.Author: Marwood
Reviews.Content: The service was very friendly. We were seated at the closest table to the door and I don't recommend sitting there since every time someone goes in and out you are wafted with a strong blow of cold air (early spring).  The spicy miso ramen was very tasty and had a good spicy kick. I enjoyed the meal however I feel that monta and ramen ya are just as good or better.

Reviews.Author: Al
Reviews.Content: Fukin Ramen The Best! Get some appetizers first. Service is awesome. They do need some music without commercials but you are not here that long.....so.... Shut up and eat!

Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: Big hit. Great price, quick service during off hours. I make this a weekly stop. Gyoza is nice, spicy ramen with ground pork is fun also. Try everything!

Reviews.Author: Rob
Reviews.Content: Currently, I am obsessed with Ramen so on my most recent trip to Vegas, I made a pit stop here on the way to the Strip.    Very friendly staff, I ordered the Tonkotsu and the DanDan Mien. Two huge bowls came. The Tonkotsu was very good, not as rich or as thick as my last in London. The Dan Dan was bad, peanut soup. I have had this preperation many places but in none was it soo nutty as to be peanut or sesame paste soup. 1 stars for the Dan Dan and 3.5 for the Tonkotsu. Nice noodles too BTW

Reviews.Author: Annie
Reviews.Content: Small, quaint place with wood chairs and wood benches. Floor very dirty, though. Noisy too.  I had the Small Chashu Bowl and hubby had the Classic Ramen. Both dishes were very tasty but for both of them, it was 90% rice (in my case) and 90% noodles for his ramen bowl. There was waaaay too little meat for the price -- especially for the ramen bowl which was $7.50.  Again, the food tasted great but the serving was much too much of carbohydrates and very skimpy on the protein.

Reviews.Author: Ben
Reviews.Content: I'm not the best person to comment on how authentic the taste is. But so far my taste buds liked the Fukumimi ramen! I'll try the other ramen options next time. :)

Reviews.Author: Tony
Reviews.Content: If you plan to frequent this little ramen restaurant on a regular basis, be sure to ask for their stamp card.  You get a complimentary order of gyoza or chicken karaage after ordering four ramen.  Also come early to beat the dinner rush, unless you are not in a rush.  The food here is pretty good. I ordered the Fukumimi Ramen, with all of its extras on my first visit, and the soup was flavorful and very delicious. I did not care for the thin ramen noodle that was served, but that is a personal preference.  The Chicken Karaage was good, but we might have been too polite and let it sit on the plate too long, because it was a little greasy by the time I ate my first piece.  Service is friendly, efficient, even when the restaurant is at full capacity.  A great ramen spot on the east side of town.  Ambiance: 4/5  Cozy little spot that is well lit and clean, with view of portion of the kitchen.  It has no fancy decor, but ramen is fast food and who has time to get distracted by anything except that steamy hot bowl of noodles and brothy goodness once it is placed on your table.  Service:  4/5  No compliant.  Food:  4/5  Wonderful flavor, portion is not huge, but enough to satiate most appetites.   Price:  4/5  Competitive.  Parking:  4.5/5  Plenty when I went in the evening, even when the restaurant is packed.  Solid 4 stars!

Reviews.Author: Clarence
Reviews.Content: Their Tonkotsu ramen was pretty tasty, especially the broth. It would have been nice to have the option to pay extra for extra noodles though.

Reviews.Author: Diana
Reviews.Content: Sorry Monta, I've found a new lover and its name is Fukumimi.   The best tonkotsu ramen I've tried so far in Vegas is made at this modest establishment, located in a mostly-dead strip mall. The broth is marvelously rich and flavorful. The noodles are perfectly cooked, not too firm nor soggy and absorb the noodle base's flavor. The egg is amazingly seasoned and I've never had a yolk that was so buttery and rich. The chashu is a bit thicker than at Monta's, cooked to the perfect level of tenderness. You can appreciate the meat and its slow-cooked flavor in your mouth instead of just instantly falling apart as soon as you bite into it. At times I sort of wish they served menma instead of bean sprouts but its by no means a detractor to the ramen.   The spicy ramen isn't necessarily  spicy  - I think the heat is there to mainly enhance the soup base and it doesn't mask the other flavors in the soup.   I easily get full on a bowl of ramen (or any entree) so I don't usually get side dishes/appetizers when I eat out. Fukumimi, though, does offer a stamp card and offers free karaage after four ramen visits (and served to you on your fifth), so I ended up trying that. It was definitely not what I was expecting, the fried chicken was deliciously seasoned, the dark meat tender and juicy and the grey salt provided on the side gave the dish more punch. Wasn't a big fan of the dressing on the greens that came with the chicken, but my boyfriend really liked it, so there you go.  You'll need to ask for additional condiments if you like to add seasonings to your dish, since they're not provided on the tables. Interestingly at Monta I often reach for their condiments and use most of them in my ramen, but here I don't find myself missing them - for me, the ramen is that good as it is. Decor is minimal and clean. Sort of wish it was a bit more warm rather than plain plywood but whatever, we're here for food not lodging. Service is a-ok, no complaints there. Like many Vegas establishments, a gem located in an otherwise unremarkable strip mall.

Reviews.Author: Sammi
Reviews.Content: We were in Vegas from San Diego and found this place on yelp for a late Sunday dinner (around 8:45). We ordered the Honey Garlic Chicken for an appetizer, which was delicious! We both ordered the Fukumimi Ramen for dinner and it was also very good. Lots of meat in it, which is usually my biggest gripe if there isn't enough. My favorite part was the soft boiled egg in it. Adds some nice flavor instead of tasting like a dry egg. We grabbed a stamp card on the way out because we know we'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Author: India
Reviews.Content: the venu can look way better than it is, they have a kitchen in the dining area and two sheets of blankets covering the kitchen part. barely any space but dueable. custmer service was good but could be better by checking up on us or simple refills on our drinks. we got the garlic chicken for an appetitizer and spicy meso ramen for our entr√©e.        for starters the garlic chicken was very fatty and crispy, which is how it should be. they had a dressing that gets drizzled on top of the chicken and it really compliments the crispy chicken! ( the dressing is my fave part of this dish )                   lastly the spicy ramen, the noddles were to die for perfectly cooked off tops! the soup broth is thick and you can taste the yolks inside the broth. there was slices of beef in the soup that were a weebit raw but perfectly cooked. the meat made the soup better. overall the place was pretty yummy.

Reviews.Author: jellie
Reviews.Content: I have been craving for some authentic ramen for awhile now since my favorite ramen house closed,,so after yelping I decided to try this joint,,and OMG! what can I say it hit the spot and so much more!! their broth is perfect and not too creamy/fatty as monta.. It was just the perfect amount of serving and everything is just so good..I think the best part is that its location is so close to my house and now I dont have to go to Chinatown just for ramen..Im so excited for the weather to get cooler so I can have an excuse to eat it everyday!

Reviews.Author: Thao
Reviews.Content: We were in dyer need of some hangover food so instead of our usual Pho , the group decided on ramen. We came here on a whim, I think most of us wished we went with pho instead.   The ramen was just OK at the most. I guess if you are near by it's ok instead of driving somewhere on the strip.

Reviews.Author: Alan
Reviews.Content: Decent Food, TERRIBLE service. I would give the food 3 stars, decent, but definitely not the best in Las Vegas, there are much better places. What really turned us off was the attitude. My wife asked for hot water and WAS told RUDELY that they did not have hot water. Really? A restaurant that does not have water or microwave oven? Hard to believe.

Reviews.Author: Amy
Reviews.Content: I'm not a well-traveled, highly-experienced Ramen connoisseur. I've only been to one other Ramen place beside Fukumimi and I liked Fukumimi better, so this is where we like to go. So when my stepfather, the judo sensei/shinto priest who lived in Japan for over 20 years visited and asked where we should go for Ramen, I just hoped Fukumimi would live up to his standard.  We were a party of 5 and had to wait about 15 minutes for a table on a busy Saturday night. It's a little tough to wait in such a crowded front area, but luckily the turnover is really fast, and really, once we sat down to eat it was totally worth it. For an appetizer, we ordered gyoza and the Kimchi. The gyoza were wrapped paper thin, crispy on one side, and piping hot. Delicious. The Kimchi was perfectly spicy and a good portion.   Almost everyone in our party had something different: the Miso Tonkatsu was creamy and had a light sweetness imparted by the addition of corn, the Salt (Soy) Tonkatsu was a salty, full-bodied soup given added depth with seaweed and green onions, the Spicy Tonkatsu was medium-spicy yet still almost creamy in it's richness, and the large size (sweet) pork bowl with rice and green onions hit the spot for a heartier eater. Oh, and PERFECT eggs and tender pork belly in each bowl, my favorite part. The proteins in these Ramens just melt in your mouth.   My stepdad said this is as good as any highly regarded Ramen shop in every city he lived in in Japan. He just kept saying  This is SO good!  over and over. He and my mom are in town one more week and he's jonesing for more Fukumimi one of these nights after he plays judo. So thanks for making me look good when I recommended we visit - regardless, this will always be this girl's Ramen joint.   Arigato gozaimasu!

Reviews.Author: Rachel
Reviews.Content: . Went yesterday 1-24-16 around 8PM for dinner.  This restaurant is located on Eastern and Tropicana next to Baskin Robbins.  It's kind of a small space....there's room for maybe 20 people.  It was quite crowded.  .  For just over $25.00 we got some ramen, two appetizers, two drinks, a salad, a chicken curry, and some tasty corn and rice for my boy.  I was wondering why it was so cheap but then I saw a sign on the wall that said  Free appetizer with purchase of ramen .   . I got the tonkotsu ramen (soy) and it was a very generous portion.  The broth was flavorful and just the right temperature.  It had a nice big slice of pork, a perfectly soft boiled egg, a sheet of nori, and bean sprouts.  The noodles were cooked perfectly.  Next time I think I'll try it spicy! I wanted to add some spice but there are no condiments on the table and I wasn't quite sure what to ask for to make it spicy.  *White girl problems*.  Sriracha?? I dunno.  .  Chicken Karaage- Delicious dark meat chicken lightly floured and fried to perfection.  Juicy, flavorful, crunchy, delicious!  .  Husband had the chicken curry and was practically licking the bowl after he inhaled it.  I got one bite of it and it was heavenly.  The chicken is mixed into the curry which I've never had before but it was really good.  Their rice is just about the best I've ever had...perfectly cooked, sticky, and aromatic.  .  This is really close to my house and I have a feeling they'll be seeing a lot more of me.  My only complaint would be that there is absolutely *no* place to wait inside the restaurant.  The foyer is microscopic.   Also while we were there a young man turned in an application/resume and all the staff members gathered around and laughed at it before they trashed it.  Kinda unprofessional but none of my business.

Reviews.Author: Luis
Reviews.Content: I've been to several popular ramen spots throughout Las Vegas (and even in LA) and I have to say I still use Fukumimi as the bar by which the other ramen places will be judged. This unassuming little ramen shop sits just outside the busy Strip life where you can relax and enjoy a nice bowl of piping hot tonkotsu ramen topped with their tender and flavorful pork belly chasu and perfectly seasoned nitamago--ask for extra noodles when you find yourself wanting more, trust me you will. Our staple favorites range from the spicy delicious kara-miso ramen to the hearty tantan men ramen. Fukumimi also carries several complementing side dishes such as their juicy and tender chicken karaage as well as the savory agedashi tofu which can only be best described as 'umami'! So if you crave a quick and hearty meal, take a detour off The Strip and make the drive to Fukumimi--you won't be dissappointed.

Reviews.Author: Elaine
Reviews.Content: Craving ramen on a cold night so this was the closest place from where I was from yelp. Wait time was pretty long because it's such a small restaurant but it was really good. I got the tonkatsu miso ramen, the house salad, gyoza & the honey garlic chicken  Price was really reasonable for all we got/portion sizes & everything I would say was a great experience plus the 2 female servers were nice

Reviews.Author: Rebecca
Reviews.Content: I suggested this to a visiting friend who wanted something simple.  My suggestion was based on high yelp ratings on this place.  We ordered the Tonkatsu Ramen (miso) and the big Chasu Bowl.  I had high expectations and was terribly disappointed.  The Ramen was thick but it really did not have the miso taste.  The Chasu Bowl was tastier but nothing to rave about.  The place is located in a dark strip mall, and it looked like it was popular with students based on the diners already there and the young people waiting in line.  I made a wrong choice and would not be back.

Reviews.Author: Randal
Reviews.Content: So I came here with Lisa R for lunch one day as it's near campus and fit into her lunch break.  Really happy she suggested we go here.  The ramen is delicious, the broth is delicious, and for those who don't eat pork (not my problem...) they also have chicken ramen.  They also give out loyalty cards and after your 6th visit (I think) you can get one of the choices off the card.  We got the chicken kara-age, and it was done perfectly.  Crispy exterior, moist interior, and they served it with just salt and a lemon slice, very simply done yet very tasty, plus it provided a nice texture contrast to the ramen and broth.  Overall, if you like ramen, or just want to try some good ramen, this place will not let you down.

Reviews.Author: ER
Reviews.Content: This is a hidden gem in Vegas  Away from the busy spring mountain ramen traffic, this little restaurant is very good. Not as salty as other places and it offers unique appetizers. The Karage is very good, and the Tofu is delicious with a beautiful presentation.   high recommended!

Reviews.Author: Myk
Reviews.Content: Finally a Ramen place on the east side!! I'm really excited since this place is so close to where I live!  Ok before anything else I just want to say that there is an old lady server that works here, and I think she hates me. I've been here twice and was treated with the same discourteous attitude. I tipped her $5 each time in hopes of a smile but to no avail...  Now that I got that off my chest it's down to business.  Fukumimi is known for their Tan Tan Men, (a spicy, very rich ramen) and their flaky karaage (fried battered chicken tenders that is a perfect match to your warm bowl of ramen).   Lets start of with the noodles. Just like Monta Ramen House, they serve their ramen with firm noodles, I personally prefer Sapporo style noodles since it's more chewy, but there's nothing wrong with Fukumimi's straighter and firmer noodles.  The base of the Tan Tan men is hot and tasty. I had no problem slurping down their savory and slightly spicy ramen until I reached 3/4 of the bowl, at that point I was overwhelmed by its richness. Now I'm the kind of person who gets the XL bowls and order side dishes all over the table, yes that's me, but on this occasion, it was just a bowl of ramen and a side of karaage, but with just that I was already feeling heavy.  It's a well known fact that you can't have a bowl of hot ramen (in america) without chasu pork (those thinly sliced marinated braised pork bellies that melts in your mouth as you sip your steaming bowl of ramen).  Also adding a Tamago  (24 hour marinated hard boiled egg) with every ramen bowl wouldn't hurt.  Summary:  Noodles: Firm noodles Ramen Base (Tan Tan Men):  Mild, Tasty, and Heavy Chasu pork: Thicker cut than usual, and not melt -in-your-mouth like Monta's Karaage: Chicken is tender, and Batter is nice and flaky.  Soboro Bowl: Bland, and not satisfying Service: Just Ok

Reviews.Author: Tiara
Reviews.Content: OH MY GOODNESS! I entered the place at around 2 after the lunch crowed it took me a little while to find the place, it is BEHIND wallgreens and next to baskin robbins.  Fukumimi ramen- i got it with out the  fixins  i just got mine with pork and black garlic oil. I think they may have given me salt stock because on the Receipt said salt ramen so i'm not sure. But anyway the soup was very good very different then monta but just as good as monta to me. The pork OMG so I can't lie i'm going to have to say this places pork is better then monta, i know i know but it just falls apart and its SOO flavorful I had to order a extra order, that was 6 pcs all together, i know i was a little piggy haha!

Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: Came back and really enjoyed myself again. This time I brought my bride. We were the first ones through the door when they opened up. Now my wife isn't as adventurous as I am but she finally settled on the chicken bowl. I pulled a classic me and ordered the same thing I had last time. The tantan men ramen. I also ordered the karaage chicken. Mostly for Laurie as I know she loves chicken. Our order was up hot and fresh in a matter of 5-6 minutes. I can't completely describe the flavors of my ramen other than to say it was so rich and wonderful, that I could easily make a slob of myself and eat 2 full bowls! The karaage chicken was somehow even better than last time. It was piping hot but so flavorful and juicy. I still really wish this place wasn't so far from my house. I will be back, and I will once again be hungry for ramen!

Reviews.Author: Mina
Reviews.Content: My friend recommended me to Fukumimi and I was really excited to try their ramen! But all of their base was Tonkotsu, and it was mixed with an additional flavor such as soy (shoyu), miso, salt (shio) etc., so it didn't really have a solid flavor. I ordered the Tonkotsu Miso Ramen, and I wasn't quite sure what the main flavor was, it was just all jumbled up together.   We also ordered appetizers, the Gyoza & the chicken karaage. I absolutely love karaage and was super excited to try them! But they were EXTREMELY salty, and after one bite, I drank more than half of the water that I had. It was so salty, that when I ate my ramen after, all I got was salt flavor. My tongue was still burning after I got home, and I had to drink several more bottles of water to get rid of that burn I had. It was so painful I never wanted to eat karaage again.   The waiters were okay, they never asked us how we were or anything, but weren't rude or mean. Just not very friendly? I'm really disappointed with Fukumimi and I will probably never come here again.

Reviews.Author: Reed
Reviews.Content: After reading all the rave reviews about this place, I decided to give it a go. To start things off I ordered the kaarage which came with a salad on the side.  The salad was very tasty, but the kaarage was a bit on the greasy side (didn't agree with my stomach later).  For the main dish, I decided to go with the  classic  miso ramen.  Perhaps I didn't read the menu in detail, but that miso ramen was spicy!  I was sweating bullets.  Overall, the ramen was good for Vegas, but not  the best I ever had, the best I ever had .

Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: Staff are friendly and the best chicken karaage I have tasted so far.. Nice and crispy on the outside and juicy in the inside.. I would recommend this place to friends and family..

Reviews.Author: Lois
Reviews.Content: Went to try this place out after reading  the reviews and I was not disappointed. Had the soy broth and it was hearty and savory. The ramen was not overdone, very tender and not soggy like other ramen spots. They are also very budget friendly.

Reviews.Author: Breeanne
Reviews.Content: We found this place on yelp because it was right across the street from where we got a massage.  It was a cold day so Ramen sounded really good. They had great reviews on here so we gave it a shot, and it helped being so far off the strip where prices were a lot more affordable.    We loved the Ramen! Two of us got the classic Ramen. I added some chili oil and chili flake to mine to spice it up a bit. I ate every last drop, it was amazing. We also had some edamame which was cooked to perfection.  If I ever happen to be in the Las Vegas area again, I would definitely come back.   The waitress was nice and helpful. The cooks greeted us and said goodbye. It was a great atmosphere for all ages! Thank you for lunch!

Reviews.Author: Shawn
Reviews.Content: Finally had time to drive all the way across town to give it a go!  Tried the  Tantan Men  ramen, which was a Szechuan style spicy ramen with red chili oil!  I also tried the Fukumimi ramen, which comes with extra pork, egg and nori. Everything was good here, but I think that  other  ramen place a little better.  They do give you plenty of pork though, just didn't enjoy the taste as much truthfully.  Pic :  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fukumimi-ramen-las-vegas?userid=eZZyuJDouIg4p-GYB3PV_A#zY0F82mi3QlwIK-v6L1qTQ  What I really liked was the SOBORO bowl! It was super yummy, with marinated ground pork and veggies! I kept eating my son's food, because it was that good lol!  Plus we got some extra nori because it is one of his most favorite things ever! We did have to pay $1 though, where most places are usually free for the baby....but still worth it.  Check it out :  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fukumimi-ramen-las-vegas?userid=eZZyuJDouIg4p-GYB3PV_A#UHZ-q-EvOcCzZHpcWngIxQ  Check it out if you are on this side of town....Southeast, near Trop and Eastern

Reviews.Author: Jesalina
Reviews.Content: At first we ordered 4 soups & 2 gyoza.. then added the karaage last.. everything was good but the KARAAGE(chicken) wasn't fully cooked. Seemed as if they rushed to cook it. & IT WASNT BUSY AT ALL. we told our server, we literally opened all the chicken to show our server that it's still super pink & some of them you can tell it wasn't fully cooked. We don't normally complain but she didn't take the chicken back to cook it instead she fought and said oh that's just how our meat is. Really? Undercooked? Pink and raw inside? Yuck won't order that again... if you do order it, tell them to fully cook it!

Reviews.Author: Alekz
Reviews.Content: At the moment My favorite ramen place , you have to try everything and the staff is so nice. Usually order the spicy miso but it's not as  spicy for my taste .its just probably because I like my food rely rely spicy , my second favorite is probably the tan tan men . My husband usually orders soy ramen and the karaage chicken.

Reviews.Author: Lisa
Reviews.Content: The best gyoza I've eaten anywhere.  The honey garlic fried chicken...sublime. The tan tan men, perfectly cooked ramen leisurely wading in a spicy broth made in heaven. David Chang you have some stiff competition, here in Vegas!

Reviews.Author: Nikki
Reviews.Content: Fukumimi's ramen was ok. I like Ramen Sora better. Fukumimi only have regular size ramen which will not go by my husband. I like that Ramen Sora have regular and large size ramen bowl. The Cha-shu (pork belly) of Fukumimi was so thin and didn't taste as good and from what my girl friend says,  it smells.   Not sure if I'll come back here :(.  A little disappointed! Oh and they don't have chahan (japanese fried rice) either.

Reviews.Author: Justin
Reviews.Content: Excellent Ramen flavors and the best karage chicken offered  compaired at any other ramen places in vegas area.

Reviews.Author: Pim
Reviews.Content: Over a year later, I finally came back to give this place another try! My friend had a full stamp card so we got the free chicken karaage, which was pretty much the same as last time, but crispier. I definitely liked how tender the chicken was and the contrast between that and the crispy exterior. However, the batter is already very salty and they still provide dipping salt! I dipped it anyways because i can't control myself around salt ugh.  This time around, I got the tonkotsu salt, which was actually to my liking! At only 7.90 I got a huge slice of tender  chashu, half an egg, some beansprout, and a little bit of green onion. The noodles were tender but not too soft and the broth is not bland (like I mentioned in my last review) but not too salty either! It was light and the slightly smaller-than-normal portion is perfect to make me satisfied.  Service is still the same. The tables and chairs could definitely use some sprucing up. They're all scratched up! In any case, I'll definitely come back here when I'm craving ramen and I'm in the area. Crossing the strip is just too much of a hassle for me otherwise, sorry Fukumimi. But hey, I like you guys now so you got that going for ya!

Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: Came for the Fukumimi ramen, and it was really good, wasnt creamy like Monta which i prefer. Kaarage was good for the price. Would come back.

Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: I enjoy ramen here twice a week and love the taste!  I also frequent Monta Chaya and have to say these places are almost identical in their flavor profiles.  They have slightly nicer spoons at Fukumimi :-). The service is always top notch and I'm always looking forward to my next visit.  My favorite is the miso flavor with extra pork and egg.

Reviews.Author: Martha
Reviews.Content: This delightful ramen joint hidden in plain sight on Eastern and Trop offers some of the best ramen options you may be looking for. From their signature fukumimi ramen to their miso ramen, they have the right gourmet ingredients to hit the spot. And wait... there's more. Not only do they serve their slurp-worthy noodles but they also have flavorful appetizers at such an affordable price. My favorite would have to be the honey garlic karage, in other words, honey garlic chicken and agedashi tofu. I would get to explaining on those two insanely delicious appetizers, but you'd just have to try it for yourself !!

Reviews.Author: Aprodhyta
Reviews.Content: I had the best ramen in this place! I had the spicy ramen, it was really good. And I will come back to this ramen place before leaving Vegas to have the fukumimi ramen. They both really good in different way..

Reviews.Author: HongBiao
Reviews.Content: This place has limited seating so get here before peak times. Just like many Asian restaurants, service (waiters/waitresses asking you if everything is OK, filling up half cup water, etc.) is mediocre. So if you're here expecting them to bow down to you, then this is not the place for you. I personally don't really care about service, I'm here for the food.  I got the Fukumimi special the first time I was here. The noodles was perfect, not too the soup was a bit salty though.  This time we got the gyoza and karaage. The gyoza didn't taste like they just defrosted it, very crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside.  This time I got the Tonkatsu Spicy. There was a good amount of noodles. It was not soggy and just the right amount of firmness. Soup was spicy but really salty again.  This wasn't the best ramen I had but it is up there. I had the best ramen in Honolulu, and have not been able to satisfy my ramen cravings. Still need to go to Japan to try the original but for now, if I'm in Vegas, I'll be going to this restaurant for ramen in the states.

Reviews.Author: Dell
Reviews.Content: Place is very small, tight and packed.   I didn't like the soup i had, it tasted too much peanut / oil in it. But my friend's broth tasted good. Ground pork tasted good as well. Chicken Appetizer would be better if it has any dipping sauce in it  Server was prompt and nice.   Would still come back and give it another chance

Reviews.Author: Cassie
Reviews.Content: I always love this place.  I personally am very picky considering I work in food. Im always nitpicking service, cleanliness, and taste compared to price and serving size. To be honest I loved this place. The menu is kind of small but for a small shop it's perfect. I always get the classic ramen with spicy sauce. It has a nice kick to it without setting your mouth on fire. Just enough for a slight burn which is great when you're drinking half your meal.  The portions are great in my opinion. Not much experience with ramen shops but their food is enough to fill me up completely. Prices are cheap. Flavor is wonderful. The meat in the ramen just falls apart which is great so you can break it up and have some meat in every bite!  Service has always been kind and tends to our needs. I have never had to wait for them for long at all. Only complaint is they do not have dessert. But they are right next to Baskin Robbins so it's all good lol  Also, you HAVE TO try the chicken karaage. It is so unbelievably addicting. And their salad is awesome too. I just love it here

Reviews.Author: Randy
Reviews.Content: Tonkotsu ramen had excellent flavor. Gyoza was great, too. Will definitely be back next trip to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Author: Sandi
Reviews.Content: The spicy tonkonsu ramen is the best!   I had tried pho and wasn't a fan so I was hesitant to try ramen but I couldn't have been happier. It's tasty and it's just the right portion and spice. The environment is pleasing.   Overall fukumimi is great!

Reviews.Author: Kenn
Reviews.Content: I really, really want to give Fukumimi 5 stars.  They have one of the best ramen in Vegas. They have one of the best karaage. They have one of the best cold noodle.  What's lacking is the finishing touch in the noodles - namely, the softness of the noodle.  If you are crazy about ramen, you might know that there are more than six grades of softness / hardness of noodles when you order ramen in Japan: soft, regular, hard, barikata, harigane and konaotoshi.  It gets harder as you get to the end of the list - in Japanese, barikata means  very hard ,  harigane  means steel wire,  konaotoshi  means  just drop the powder . As ridiculous as it sounds, those resolution in texture preference is for real in highly matured culture like Japanese cuisine. It's almost like the endless arms race of megapixels in digital cameras. And as you can clearly see, the grade is completely skewed toward hard noodles. Yes, it's true that hardcore ramen aficionados have the tendency to enjoy harder noodles.  But at Fukumimi, even ordering  very hard  specifically, brings disappointingly soft noodles.  I really hope they will address that particular issue, then I'll bump to five stars.

Reviews.Author: Melissa
Reviews.Content: They have a wonderful and rich broth. They run the average price for ramen around town and it's nice not to have to drive to the other side of the strip for good ramen.

Reviews.Author: Martin
Reviews.Content: Definitely a must  try when in Vegas, the taste is pretty good most ramen places in Las Vegas have good taste they only differ in condiments and offerings for side dishes.

Reviews.Author: Olivia
Reviews.Content: We found this ramen place after a long delay at the airport...we used Yelp to find a place nearby and this place was indeed a solid four stars. I ordered the salt ramen with a side of chashu rice and beer. Note, they do not have any hot beverages...so I could not get hot green tea, just iced. The bowl of ramen was good and so satisfying on this rainy day in Las Vegas. If I had a ramen carving in Las Vegas, I will definitely stop by here before heading to the airport.

Reviews.Author: Rachel
Reviews.Content: * Customer service: 5/5 The people who work here are very gracious and remember us. Greet and seat immediately, very attentive (periodically check if assistance is needed), and food is served within 15 min..  * Cleanliness: 5/5 Very clean, no matter how busy.  * Food: 5/5 I have been here several times with my BF and we always order the same thing because it's so damn good! I order the Soy Ramen which is a thinner soup base compared to the Miso Ramen. It can be a little salty but nothing too overwhelming. It comes with noodles, a boiled egg, a thin slice of soft char siu pork, a piece of seaweed, and bean sprouts (which I ask for on the side). As for the taste, it is very savory, fresh, and original.  As for my BF, he orders the Tantanmen which is a chile base ramen. I have  tried  it but never really eaten it. He loves it, but from what I have tried, it is a little spicy from the chile, and has a very herby and earthy kind of taste (I think they use sriracha for flavoring). It comes with bok-choy, noodles, a scoop of ground beef, and some other vegetable. You'll definitely want to get a side of rice with this one.  Sodas are served in a can, I don't think there are free refills. Items can also be made to-go.  * Atmosphere, wait-time, and menu size: 4/5 Restaurant is located on Eastern in an older plaza and is right next to a Baskin Robins (which tastes great after eating here, since it can be a little salty). Restaurant is very casual and tiny but even during the busiest hours, I have not had any trouble getting a seat. As for the menu, it is small and very straightforward.  * Portion size and price: 5/5 GREAT price and large portions! Both soups fill us up and cost only $8.99 each.  * Recommend or return? Of course I will return! They also gave me a punch card for a free item after several visits. Make sure you ask for it.  Though, for those of you who are coming here for the first time and don't have a normal  noodle diet , I recommend taking it easy (don't rush eating). Because, the first time we ate here, it felt as if the noodles formed a rock in our stomach. We were miserable for the entire day and had the sh***. Though we returned for a second time and received a normal experience.

Reviews.Author: Nicole
Reviews.Content: The food was delicious. At first, I compared it to Monta ramen but I think that this restaurant is its equal. The only thing I have to say is that it's a little dirty here. They should wipe down their walls and clean up a little more. But service was immediate; the hostess greeted us upon entering & quickly asked us what we would like to drink. Soon after, we ordered an appetizer and our noodles & while we waited for the noodles, the appetizer, Agedashi tofu, was AMAZING. And that's saying something, considering I don't even like tofu. Our noodles were perfect & DELICIOUS! Check out the pictures I posted!   Although I would definitely come back again, I don't think I will very often because it's far away from where I live.

Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: So my bf says he actually likes this more than pho restaurants, and he has a lot more experience than I do. But either way, this place has some really good food. He keeps ordering the Spicy Miso. I've tried the Chicken Tori Ramen, the chicken rice bowl, and tonight I'm trying out the Miso Ramen with seaweed. So far, my favorite is definitely the ramen

Reviews.Author: Ron
Reviews.Content: I came here for the first time with my brother.  I had the Chicken karage and tantan men which is a Szechuan-style broth with a large meatball.  This was the first time I have had Japanese Ramen.  The broth is so spicy, hot, and savory.  I love coming to Vegas and trying new restaurants with my brother.  This restaurant does not disappoint.  In fact I craved it so much I came back here the next day.  I know I should have tried something else from the menu but my lunch was so good I ordered the exact same thing.  I recommend.

Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: The ramen here is amazing. I almost died when I took my first bite of the chashu pork. The agedashi tofu and chicken karage were exuberant as well.

Reviews.Author: Chrisene-Faye
Reviews.Content: Yay a ramen hut that's not in Chinatown! If you are looking for hearty tasty fatty ramen broth, you've come to the right place!  No other ramen place in Vegas adds garlic oil to their ramen.  Their chaschu pork is so soft and tender (similar to Monta).  They give you the perfect serving amount.  Best ramen hut in Vegas!  Also, they give you a punch card where you can get karage or gyozas for free!

Reviews.Author: Nicole
Reviews.Content: Never disappointed. Their ramen broth is so rich and layered with flavors. Also, the price is great! So far my favorite is the kogashi ramen. Give it a try, it has rich almost burnt soy flavors.

Reviews.Author: R
Reviews.Content: Fantasic! One word!  AWESOME authentic, and delicious. I have been twice now. almost guaranteed that  you will be waiting just a few minutes before being seated. But well worth it. the spicy Tonkotsu ramen and the tan tan men are fabulous. Great Job Fukimimi!

Reviews.Author: Eric
Reviews.Content: Came here late at night with the brother to satisfy the craving and it was correct!  I got the  Fukumimi special  I believe and it was really good! It's their  whole Sha-bang  ramen in their menu basically. It had the right amount of savoriness and a generous portion of noodles, pork slices and other garnishes. The broth was hella bomb! Definitely lifted my spirits on a cold night. Probably the best ramen in Vegas and I've tried the ones down Spring Mountain.  Okay now you're probably wondering why I gave it 3-stars. The service (at that time) was bullshit. Our Eastern European-ish server chick came off as ICY and didn't care to check up on us. That bitch just sat around doing nothing; she asked another server to  take our orders and she only put them on the table and hinted at us to give HER a tip - have the fuckin' audacity! We just gave her a dolla.  Nonetheless, I'd come here again when I'm in town and craving ramen! :)

Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: This place is right down the street from where I live. I discovered after living in the area for 2 years. Turned out to be really good. I like the honey chicken and the spicy garlic ramen. I have eaten here many times since the discovery. I mostly just go to jinya now, but if you need a ramen fix this place won't disappoint.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie
Reviews.Content: Taking all the advice and trying the Tantan Men  It was Friday and it was cold. Ramen is what was needed!  Most fellow Yelpers gave glowing reviews, and Tetsuro's yelp really got my attention for tantan men.  I ordered ahead, adding an egg and green onion.  It was ready when I got there to pick it up, and it was packaged with consideration and regard knowing a little time & travel pass before consuming.  The broth and the other ingredients (spicy pork, bok choy, ramen noodles, egg, and green onion) were in two separate containers.  Back at the office, I combined the broth with the ingredients, stirred gently, and enjoyed the savoriness of this dish.  The broth is a juxtaposition of slight creaminess and a hint of spiciness as the spicy pork slowly & chili oil slowly become fused.  Like a good wine, it actually became better as I tasted, mixed, and tasted again.  A generous serving of green onion and perfectly cooked ramen noodles topped off a remarkable broth.  Looking forward to trying their spicy miso broth next time!

Reviews.Author: Samantha
Reviews.Content: I have to admit up front that I am NOT a ramen connoisseur. I enjoy it, I eat it, I seek it out. But I am not the local ramen expert that I know some of my fellow Yelpers are.   But I know soulful, textured, thoughtful food. And Fukumimi Ramen is serving that in droves.   SERVICE: Like any restaurant, the experience starts with a greeting. The staff there is wonderful. They are warm, informative, helpful, and even on a busy night, they are willing to make yours a pleasurable experience.  There are not enough places in town that care about how their customers are treated. I like to give my business to those who do.  FOOD: I have never had anything like their broth. It's rich and complex. At my first bite, my taste buds were prepped for a thin, savory broth. But upon tasting what Fukimimi Ramen calls a broth, I had to stop and pause. I actually put my chopsticks and spoon down to reflect. When was the last time a taste of broth gave you pause? Since I had the Fukumimi Ramen I can only speak about its pleasures. Add the noodles, the green onion, the extra pork belly, and the egg to that rich broth and you have a dish to drive all the way to Eastern and Trop to try.  The Fukumimi and the karaage are spectacular.  The karaage is a salty, tender, perfectly fried piece of chicken.  But all of its crunchy pleasures could not take away from that ramen dish.  And three cheers for their portion sizes. It was a joy not to be swimming in ridiculous amounts of uneaten food after my meal.  THE REVELATION: The egg. I don't know if theirs is completely unique, but it was certainly unique to me. It is officially my favorite egg. I unsuccessfully tried to coax a secret out of the chef. All I know is this: I could eat that soy sauce flavored egg every day of my life. Every day. They are magic. I need to find out if there is a dish that is focused on eggs there. The eggs are that serious for me.  TIPS: They have a frequent visitor card that entitles you to a karaage (I believe) after a few visits. Also, they have  small space, so you might want to pop in at an off time to ensure you get the experience during a quiet time. They get some traffic in the evenings.  Don't let the neighborhood keep you away. It's in a working class area that is located next to a busy street (Trop)--no need to pull up and be concerned.    They've been open for a little over a week, and I've been back three times. I know people are excited about getting the gyoza going, but there is so much to love there that foodies will never miss it.    I plan to add this to my place to my regular rotation. Their location next to a Baskin and Robbins may become an issue this summer, but luckily I leave so satisfied that ice cream isn't even a consideration.  At least not on a chilly November night.  They deserve every one of those five stars. This place is outstanding.  Even if they never give me the secret of the egg.

Reviews.Author: Joy
Reviews.Content: It was close to our hotel and had a lot of great reviews.   Tonkatsu ramen (soy) was too salty for my taste.   Honey garlic chicken was too sweet. Wish it had more garlic flavor than honey. It was drenched in honey and made the chicken soggy.

Reviews.Author: A
Reviews.Content: Ordered the karaage which was served with a side of lettuce. Unfortunately, we found a substantial amount of rotting/wilted lettuce in the mixed greens. I ordered the fukumimi ramen - the broth was quite good: sweet and rich while avoiding the bitterness that plague other restaurants. The noodles were a bit undercooked for my liking and require a quick rinse to avoid the starchiness that clouds the flavor of the broth. Service was prompt and friendly.

Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: Love Fukumimi Ramen. I always get one of the Tonkotsu bowls. I only wish they had more than 1 piece of pork like Monta does.  Otherwise, great consistent Ramen, with a nice soft egg.

Reviews.Author: S
Reviews.Content: My military husband was impressed. He Said, just like they served it in iwakuni . Easy on the wallet. $2 beer. Hot and deliciois. 4 bowls gets free appetizer and a punch card.

Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: Next to Ramen Sora, this also hits the Ramen spot.  I finally got to try this place with the BF and we both loved it!  I ordered the Miso Fukumimi Ramen.  The seasoned egg in my Ramen was my favorite part!  Their broth here is so on point.  It's creamy, not too salty, and the flavor totally knocks me off my feet.  The broth is also my favorite part; next to that lovely egg.  I swear...that egg! The pork in my ramen was also good, but slices aren't as thick as the ones at Ramen Sora.   My man ordered the Salt Fukumimi Ramen and was also in love with the broth.  He enjoyed the entire bowl too and loved it!    We are definitely coming back to this spot for Ramen!

Reviews.Author: Richard
Reviews.Content: Walked in and I sat at the bar which I normally wouldn't but today I was wearing an extra long shirt so no free shows for the other patrons sitting behind me at the tables. All their beverages come in a can so if your expecting refills you will be paying by the drink. After getting the menu I asked the server which I told her that this was my first time here to get have some assistance on what they would recommend. My server suggested I try the Kara-Miso Ramen,  which if you don't like any spice then don't get this one. It wasn't Atomic Hot but it had a little bite to it the meat that came with was rather thin so it dissolved into the bowl, I did like that it came with half a egg and corn, if your using corn to see if your regular I would ask for extra to ensure you actually see it if it's for that purpose.   The Kaarage (Japanese Style Fried Chicken) appetizer, I can't really call It an appetizer if it comes after your ramen it gets renamed a side dish to the ramen.   OWNER OF FUKUMIMI, below is the definition of an appetizer. (I googled it so it's gotta be right)  ap¬∑pe¬∑tiz¬∑er aptƒ´zr/ noun a small dish of food or a drink taken before a meal or the main course of a meal to stimulate one's appetite. synonyms: starter, first course, hors d'oeuvre, antipasto, amuse-gueule, amuse-bouche  tonight's featured appetizer is a dish of grilled oysters and roasted mushrooms.  Ok so the Kaarage (Japanese Style Fried Chicken) let's just say Fried Chicken is best left to those who know what Fried Chicken is supposed to be like, whether it's a style or not it wasn't my cup of tea, I see other reviews the people go ga-ga over it no we're not talking Lady GA-GA, to me it had a grizzled taste to it and if I have to work harder than normal to eat my food in expending calories that should be done on a tread mill or getting chased down the street by a pack of Pit Bull puppies...

Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: This place is the best ramen in town!! Try the fukumimi ramen , you can make it spicy if you like, but everything is great!! the Karage is delicious . Perfection everytime!

Reviews.Author: Ashley
Reviews.Content: I gave this place 3 stars because the service was OK and the broth was a little salty to me.   I tried the fukumimi chicken and like I said before, I like a lot of broth in my ramen (usually less noodles) and the upgrade to getting more soup is $4.00 TOTALLY OVERPRICED. When I go to other ramen places it's more like $1-1.50.   When I asked for more broth, the server looked at me like I was crazy. (maybe since it's new, I was the first person to ask.. BUT STILL. Educate yourself on where you work. = my opinion)   This is the closest decent ramen place near UNLV so I might be back... but only for that reason.

Reviews.Author: Rebecca
Reviews.Content: In the race to monopolize on the booming ramen fad in Vegas, Fukumimi has created a splash in the ramen-ya scene.   The quick and dirty: get the Fukumimi Ramen (shio-based). Your taste buds will thank you.   The long and delectably disgustingly delicious:  My friend's first reaction to seeing the The Fukumimi Ramen:  Wtf is that black stuff floating in there?!  My response:  It's black garlic oil, noob!   So if any of you guys are hesitant about the layer of questionable black oily liquid floating in your broth, know that it's good for your tummy, your heart, and your soul.  But seriously, I loved the black garlic oil that they put in the broth- only adds more depth to this deceptively simple-tasting broth. It's not as hearty as some tonkotsu broths I've tried in the past, but it still packs a punch taste-wise. Best part of this broth is that it's not overly salty like some other ramen places...*cough* Monta *cough*  The only noodles available here are the thinner egg style noodles that regularly come with tonkotsu ramen. Even though I prefer thick noodles (Ramen Sora!!) the noodles here were perfectly al dente, not soggy at all.  The egg is always perfectly done with the yolk still half runny. Chashu is a bit well done compared to what I prefer. I love when that delicious pork belly melts in your mouth!  Soboro bowl: seasoned minced meat, egg, rice, and green onions. Very simple dish. I felt like this dish was just okay, not really memorable or something I would crave. I'd have liked a bit more of sauce/juice/gravy from the minced meat so it wouldn't be so dry.  Karaage: deep fried chicken. While very juicy and fresh, I felt it was a bit under-seasoned.   If you intend to come here regularly, make sure you get a stamp card from your server. For every four bowls of ramen, you get a free appetizer: gyoza or karaage.  Overall, great service and a clean restaurant. I'll definitely be coming back for more ramen and to try their other bowls.

Reviews.Author: Jiny
Reviews.Content: I came here with high expectation because of Yelp and I gotta say, it was quite disappointing. The service was good. The server women were extremely nice and quick.   Then came the food. I ordered the Kogashi Ramen ($8.20) which supposedly has good amount of garlic flavor or whatever because of my love for Monta's Kuro Ramen aka black garlic. The bowl was smaller than Monta's, good presentation. The flavor was nothing garlicky or full of aroma like I expected. It was good broth, very peppery, but not good enough. I didn't like the noodles. The SUPER weird thing that I HATED was the addition bean sprout, though it was my fault for not fully read the description. The broth flavor was completely overwhelmed by the bean sprout for me. Extremely tender and flavorful Chashu but the pieces were wayyyyyy to small, almost seemed like they disappeared into the noodles.  My friend got a Fukumimi Ramen ($9.50) and it was the most disappointing bowl of noodles. She got it because it said  extra Chashu  but turned out, she got way less meat than I did. Extra means more than 3 but she got exactly 3 pieces. Maybe they were way too small in size that they weren't significant enough. The broth was okay, nothing notable. To be honest she disliked it. I didn't think it was worth it for the price or the way they described it on the menu. We didn't want to compare this place to Monta, but even the people who were sitting behind us mentioned about Monta in their conversation so...  We also got Karaage Chicken which is Japanese fried chicken. It was supposed to be an appetizer but we got it AT THE END of the meal. I was annoyed. But I thought it was okay, but a little over-salted. They used dark meat that's very tender. Very good coating. The thing is, they had like a pile of overdressed salad with very liquidy dressing so it soaked the fried chicken pieces. The chickens were soggy after a while. I don't think the addition of salad was necessary because why???  Overall we just didn't enjoy the restaurant as much as how I anticipated it.
