I get why they have the stamp system or the  eat 4 ramens get a free appetizer  to attract customers but it just didn't work for me. Everything was missing a notch of goodness to get to that level. Monta is still in the lead by a huge margin. This place is still improving but I won't be around to see the improvements.

Reviews.Author: Kareena
Reviews.Content: Fukumimi's broth is one of my faves here in Vegas! It's so rich and hearty--it's seriously the perfect dish for any hang over or sweater weather days lol.   My absolute favorite thing about Fukumimi is their stamp card program. Every time you purchase 4 ramens, you get a FREE appetizer your next visit. (Anything free is honestly worth Yelp-ing about.) ¬Ø\_(„ÉÑ)_/¬Ø   I also love their kimchi for their ramen. It's so tasty, it really does completes my ramen. I always get the Spicy Miso Ramen with kimchi and corn, but if it's your first time here, you can never go wrong with the Fukumimi Ramen.   This establishment is very small, so its not too great for parties with 5 or more people (you'll seriously be waiting A WHILE.) Good tip though: make sure everybody in your party is present or they will NOT seat you. ¬Ø\_(„ÉÑ)_/¬Ø

Reviews.Author: Jewelyn
Reviews.Content: Besides the random homeless lady walking in and disturbing not just me but every customer eating in there... The workers kinda just let her bother all the customers because they didn't really stop her.   This place is legit. Guess location is the problem? Figure I try other ramen spots before my go to.   Been here once. I hope to not get bother by a homeless if I eve eat here again.

Reviews.Author: Osu
Reviews.Content: Short: Good ramen, good variety of sides, decent service. Go here if you're in the area and not willing to go to Chinatown for Monta or Sora Ramen.  Long:  Not as good as Monta Ramen, better than Sora  -- is the best I can say of this place. Monta Ramen, IMO, is one of the best restaurants in Vegas. Being not as good, is a great compliment from me.  The waitress was prompt, but we got our ramen before our Karaage--which is a bit odd, and made me think if she didn't get out order out right. Service was quick, but it also wasn't very busy that day. I ordered Tonkatsu ramen with a side of Karaage to split. Ramen noodles were good; side-toppings were average (can't do much with them otherwise); the broth was good--but just not as rich as Monta ramen's. While also you only get a single slice of Chashu pork (unless you order extra, or go for a more expensive bowl of ramen). Karaage was to be expected (and served with a simple salad); chicken thighs fried and served hot. They came with a side of salad. But, there wasn't much flavor to the karaage. I couldn't taste much other than chicken, breading, and salt--while good, just kinda lacking in the ginger and soy sauce aspect of karaage.   Should you go here? Yes, definitely. It's good; but there's better ramen places in Vegas you might also want to try.

Reviews.Author: Irish
Reviews.Content: its a small space resto....got their own version of tankutsu ramen with bean sprouts and we extra veggie...good service...

Reviews.Author: Bronsen
Reviews.Content: Fukumimi Ramen is a spot that my wife and I frequent as it is one of the few places on the east side that serves good ramen.  I usually opt for the ramen with the chicken broth when I come down to eat at Fukumimi and it always hits the spot.  However, when I'm not in the mood for ramen and somehow end up here, I grub on a kimchi bowl with a side of egg. I absolutely love the shoyu egg here.. perhaps more than the ramen? It's just that good. What can I say, I love eggs haha.  I have to find out how they make it... But in the meantime, I'll be frequenting often to get that ramen / egg goodness. Yep, I'm weird.. I know.  Anyway, good ramen eats on the East side! Definitely will be back soon! (This review is actually being done from Fukumimi while I wait for my food.. oh, here it comes! Gotta go!)

Reviews.Author: Rachelle
Reviews.Content: The best Ramen! My favorite is the Fukumimi Ramen, but Tantan Men is really good too! Plus their staff are great! Too bad it's a bit far from where we live. But the drive is always worth it!

Reviews.Author: Britt
Reviews.Content: Very good flavor! They were closed today for lunch and I waited till dinner to bring the family! Small place, long line is worth it!

Reviews.Author: Lorenzita
Reviews.Content: The food here is fantastic, my group ordered ramen dishes and compared to Monta it's more flavorful and less salty. My one real issue is the slightly awkward papers saying the restaurant is #1 plastered 5 times on the wall along with messy looking menu. Service was good, asked us for water and smiled. Overall it was a good experience.

Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: Love these  hole-in-walls . Was able to be seated quickly. Courteous greeting and service. Karaage chicken appetizer was really tasty. Ramen had great broth and good, chewy noodles. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: Solid little joint!  Not a whole lot to the menu but they don't need it.  Their items are pretty tasty.  We ordered tan tan men, curry rice and chicken karaage.  All of the items were delicious and cheap!  Best of the all, the noodles were the right consistency.  mmmm LOVE ramen places.   Next time I'll try their shoiyu broth with Chasyu.

Reviews.Author: Julie
Reviews.Content: Came here on a Saturday night with my man friend and were pleasantly surprised at the emptiness of the restaurant.. ( I really hate waiting.. who doesn't?) Any who.. we already knew what we wanted to get before coming here..   Karaage _ Like everyone has already said.. It is delish!!! Crispy but not oily~ good portion too~!  Fukumimi ramen_ i asked to add some garlic oil to it but I don't know if that even made a difference. I thought it was pretty tasty.. Pretty rich but not TOO porky.. and not overly salty like Monta's ... & Noodles were cooked perfectly.  Tan Tan Men_ It was my first time trying this dish and I thought it was pretty good.. It had some sort of deep nutty flavor to it.. I don't really like nuts that much LOL so i was good just stealing a couple bites from my bf~   Kimchi_ my BF really liked their kimchi haha it is more of the fresher variety so it didn't have that fermented sour taste that I like..   Nice waitresses & chefs, fast service! Check it out if you're in the area ;]]]

Reviews.Author: Bernadette
Reviews.Content: Good food, good service, good price! Hands down, it's the best place in town for ramen. I usually get the Kara-miso (spicy miso) ramen, but with the thin noodles - the spice level is just right. The bowls and appetizers are pretty tasty too. Our family loves this place and we could eat here every week if they had a closer location to our house.

Reviews.Author: Leonel
Reviews.Content: If you ever find yourself on the east side of the meadows and find yourself craving some of that wonderful ramen you find on the Asian strip, worry no more. A new ramen place just opened up on this side of town and I'm sure that is here to stay!  FukUmimi.......don't know what that means, but all I know is that it translates into some fuk'n good ramen! and even though this place is on the other side of town away from the competition, it is sure to make all other ramen places sweat. I can't say that is the best but it is sure up there with the big Monta and Sora.  I ordered the miso ramen. The broth was thick and packed with intense flavors, the noodles were soft and chewy, the slices of pork also soft as butter. It all was gone in a matter of minutes. Left me wondering if it had actually been real, but the empty bowl, the bill on the table and my hunger gone, confirmed it all. I had just had a bowl of awesomeness.   The place is small but very inviting, the simplicity of the design a very common Japanese characteristic gives it the feel of authenticity, as well as the majority of customers at that time. Koreans? Japanese? I don't know..all I know is that this Mexican was enjoying his noodles like everyone else in the building. For one brief  tasty moment in time, we were all speaking the same ramen language. slurp! slurp! slurp!  There are also other items on the menu that I had never had before like tantanmen which is what I will try next time I visit, or karaage, or curry.... I can't wait to head east!  Monta.....Sora.....you know I love you.....But I'm going to FukUmimi!

Reviews.Author: Elvin
Reviews.Content: I had to get the Fukumimi Ramen because it's like their specialty or whatevves. I had high expectations. Once the ramen actually came, well I almost didn't want to eat it. No, not because I lost my appetite, but because it just looked so damn pretty!  *RAMEN BREAKDOWN*  BROTH: It was good, but not the best. It sort of lacked a richness and complexity that I'm accustomed to. 4/5  NOODLES: They were thin straight noodles. Pretty good. 4/5  EGG: Leaning towards the soft-boiled spectrum of boiled eggs. It tickled my fancy. 4.5/5  CHASHU: Okay so I rarely ever have Chashu cut so thinly, but wow that shit just straight up melted in my mouth. ACTUALLY, usually it just melted away as I was trying to pick it up with my chopsticks, but if it ever made it to my mouth still intact, it melted away, like BUTTA. 4.5/5  PRESENTATION: Beautiful. 5/5  SERVICE The servers were pretty, attentive, polite, and knowledgeable. I'm not sure if they were Japanese though, but they both did have accents. I don't care about that anyway. They're everything you look for in servers.  ATMOSPHERE Looks just like a Shinsengumi in terms of the layout and that's a good thing. Well, the Shinsengumi by my house, at least.  I approve of this ramen joint, but if I'm going to Las Vegas again, I might skip it so that I can try all the other wonderful Japanese restaurants around. Nothing personal though! I'd recommend it!

Reviews.Author: Cass
Reviews.Content: First ramen place I've tried in Las Vegas. I can see why it has such good reviews! Service is amazing and efficient.  They do not have hot tea just canned tea which is alright!   I got the tantan bowl and it was supposed to be spicy but being someone enjoys a really spicy bowl of ramen it definitely was not spicy at all. I soaked that bowl in chili powder and siracha! Then it was delicious!  Other then that it's in a odd location but plenty of parking and the place is pretty small. They won't sit you down unless everyone is present type of thing.  I do recommend this place but if you like a spicy bowl you won't find it here! But everything else was perfect (:

Reviews.Author: Brandon
Reviews.Content: I have been here twice, and both times I've been impressed.  I'm sitting at my desk, in a food coma and loving every second of it.  The staff is friendly, the food is great.  Other people say that the price is high, but so is the quality.  Apparently, in ramen, you get what you pay for, or at least you do here.

Reviews.Author: Smith
Reviews.Content: I went with a friend for dinner here. As soon as we arrive and we were greeted and seated right away. The place was small and very homely. They were busy. Our waiter came and got our ordered. We ordered the Tonkotsu (salt) and the Karaage. The Karaage was super delicious and came with 6pc. with alittle salad. The ramen was also delicious  The soup was very rich in flavor so i could only have a little of it. Service was good. Staffs were very nice.

Reviews.Author: Will
Reviews.Content: The soup was amazing, but that's about it. Noddles were super under cooked and seemed rushed. Tried to order in Japanese and got attitude for it, my bad every other Japanese place can either speak it or say I don't know how to speak Japanese without attitude. We were no even done eating and the server came twice asking if we were done as we are still eating. She mind as well kicked us out and ask for a tip. Still tipped her good for her garbage service.

Reviews.Author: Maria
Reviews.Content: I went to Fukumimi because I want to try other ramen shop other than Monta. I absolutely do love Monta, but I want to keep my option open because Monta get crowded too much.   I got the Tonkatsu(soy) which already have an egg, chasu pork, and sea weed wrap.  I have to say, it's a great deal.   The noodles were good, a little too firm than I would like them. However, I also prefer thick wavy noodles, and they only had thin ones.   The broth was okay, nothing special. I thought it was a little bland.   Now if their pork was as soft as Monta, I would have been sold, but it was. They felt dry, and the main reason why I love Monta is because of their super soft melt in your mouth tender.   All in all, I give it a 3.5 star because there was no line, close to work, and the location is easily accessible.

Reviews.Author: Jerome
Reviews.Content: Proabably my new favorite ramen place in vegas. The tan tan men is the necessary move when here. It's rich and nutty and really amazing.  Worth the drive from the other side of town for sure

Reviews.Author: Tamara
Reviews.Content: They would not accommodate a simple request to make a Ramen base with miso and water as I am vegetarian.  However, I ordered the fried tofu (amazing) without the sauce and a side of steamed rice.  I was able to combine these two items to make something tasty using a little soy sauce and siracha.  My non-vegetarian friends enjoyed the food very much.

Reviews.Author: Tim
Reviews.Content: Really good tonkotsu miso ramen, noodles were cooked perfectly. Serving size is fine, maybe a bit small but no complaints. Location is easy to find but I always find it odd eating in a strip mall. Pretty good gyoza, too.

Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: No wait, better noodles, cheaper and more choices of drinks vs. Ramen Sora. If they had fried rice as good as Ramen Sora I wouldn't bother going to Ramen Sora anymore. Fukumini also does a frequent buyer rewards card and all you have to do is get pass your fourth bowl for a  free appetizer.

Reviews.Author: Sandi
Reviews.Content: A NYers review. Not my favorite place. I've had plenty of Ramen soup. Everything about the soup was OFF. The noodles weren't right, the chicken broth and Miso were greasy... i ate half and sort of started to get grossed out from the fatty smell. I did get the Japanese fried chicken appt, good gosh, i could not bite into in the chicken. Gross. Nah nah.. i dont recommend!

Reviews.Author: Lan
Reviews.Content: This place is creeping up in ratings:)  I tried the Fukumimi Miso style.  I don't think I've had as  generous a bowl of ramen anywhere else.  You get three large pieces of charsiu that is fatty and the most delicious I've had yet.  You also get seaweed and a seasoned egg.  I've not made it out to monta house yet, b/c this place is just that good.

Reviews.Author: Janel
Reviews.Content: Their quality of ramen is pretty good. I'm not completely sold to choosing them over Monta, but their slice of pork is pretty thick and impressive! Also tender. I highly recommend their tonkatso miso ramen as I love that nice thick broth. It was filled with corn, green onions, and medium boiled egg.   The noodles have a nice chew to it. Not too soggy and not too under cooked either. The broth was full of flavor. The pork had that nice consistency of chewiness, and the ramen all together was full of flavor.   I also recommend the fried gyoza as a side, and their homemade kimchee. Not up for ramen. I highly RECOMMEND the Chasu bowl (pork and white rice, with ginger). It's so delish and it too is full of flavor. It has a very subtle sweetness to it which I love and is also very tender and nicely marinated. I think if the ramen doesn't win me over from Monta, I'd say their Chasu bowl does.   The vibe also brings out that nice grassroots local Japanese feel with the small establishment, wooden seats, and specials hand written and posted on the walls. The location is very off from what most typical Japanese restaurants are, and is a bit out of the way for me, but if you're in that side of town or have that nice gap between classes from UNLV it would be a nice place for lunch. I have yet to try their sesame broth which I think is also one of their signature ramen bowls. I'm not fond of the sesame flavor though as those flavors are typically too strong for my taste buds. If you do, definitely let me know how it is!

Reviews.Author: Toshi
Reviews.Content: I yelped from LAS airport and happened to find Fukumimi Ramen.  I usually go to restaurants around Decatur Blvd in the west part of Las Vegas, so I was not aware of this restaurant.   I ordered a regular tonkotsu Ramen and it was indeed a right choice.  Noodles were al dente and the tonkotsu soup broth was really authentic.  It was so delicious that I can't wait to come back again.  Also, I recommend their gyoza as well.  Don't forget to order one!

Reviews.Author: Kristi
Reviews.Content: First time there, and wonderful service! Our waitress answered all of my questions. Food was so delicious! And the presentation was beautiful!

Reviews.Author: Daisy
Reviews.Content: I found this place out of the blue  thankful I hit the jackpot for a noodle restaurant . I ordered the pork pot stickers and spicy ramen. I can honestly say this is the best noodle house in town hands down ! Although its location isn't the best it's truly a hidden charm of delicious. I was so impress and delighted with my spicy ramen that I went home to tell my hubby all about it. I could not wait to take my family her for a delicious and affordable meal. The prices are really reasonable and the staff is friendly. It's a very small restaurant so don't bring a crowd. Hope u enjoy it as much I did.

Reviews.Author: Jesse
Reviews.Content: My fiancee stumbled into this place last week and sent me countless mouth watering pics of the Fukumimi Ramen.  I had to try it for myself.  I said to myself,  this place must be good,  considering my lady isn't a big ramen eater due to her carb conflicts.    So we come in on a Sunday after a long night of partying with good friends...once inside, you can immediately smell the fresh handmade ramen being drained from boiling pots...good sign.  The service is fast friendly and accommodating...another good sign. The crowd, diverse and was a good mixture of sophisticated, casual, multi aged and ethnic heads that I would like to think have a respect for some Japanese ramen other than meals out the instant dinner section at your local grocery store.  I checked out the menu and could see myself ordering numerous dishes...so if in doubt, go with the flagship dish, which was the Fukumimi ramen.  Let's throw in some karaage chicken as well...HiYah!  As the bowl came out, it was aesthetically appealing to say the least.  A pair of nori paper sheets lined the far side of the bowl, the ramen was nicely bunched and the broth was drizzled with some additives that made the dish look mouth watering.    5-7 minutes later...  The bowl was demolished and the verdict is...not bad.  I would say its more on the modern variations of ramen versus the authentic versions Monta offers.  The broth is good and not overwhelming with too much or too little flavoring.  The Chashu is similar to red charsiu roast pork versus the fatty version Monta offers.  I personally like the fatty version, but I can see others settling for the healthier choice.   I still remember Tenkaippen back in Waikiki, Hawaii, which I worked for a day, and it reminded me began to think of all the ramen places back home, including Goma-Tei that I would say is the closest resemblance that I could compare to Fukumimi.  I would rather Monta, now that I know to add more hot water to their broth since it is a little salty for my taste.  Worth a shot, enjoy.

Reviews.Author: Danny
Reviews.Content: Honey Garlic Chicken could end a war if offered as a piece offering.  Seriously.. Don't pass on it.

Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: Wow, just wow. There were so many wrong things about this ramen. Compared to LA, this just falls really short. Hadn't eaten ramen in a while since I've moved here from LA. Thought this place would be a good place to try cuz of the good reviews. I ordered the spicy signature ramen. First of all, for the price, the bowl was too small and the portions were too small. This is coming from a girl....Seriously, only one slice of pork? Didn't know pork was so expensive...? They're wasn't any ginger or chili oil.  I ordered spicy...but to me it was just plain salty. Is that normal? The quality of the ramen noodles was also very disappointing. It tasted and looked like instant noodles you buy from the market. I can only hope the other ramen places here in Vegas are better than this.

Reviews.Author: Emil
Reviews.Content: Ok, this place served the best bowl of ramen that I've ever eaten. I admit that I was skeptical at first when my friend told me about this place. I've had their signature Fukumimi ramen and their Tan Tan Men.   I prefer the Fukumimi ramen. In my opinion a good tonkotsu should have flavorful broth but not to the point where you feeling like you're drinking liquefied lard. This bowl fits the bill. The noodles are the straight kind, the kind that I like.  If you like a good spicy bowl of noodles then definitely you should try the Tan Tan Men. The broth was a bit too thick and creamy for me, but it was still good. The broth was begging to have extra noodles added! It was spicy but not overly spicy where you can't taste anything.  I also had their karaage. It was very juicy and tender. One of the best I've had.  Their service was really quick and friendly.  This place definitely is the best ramen shop in the Vegas area. Monta used to be my go-to place, but now it is here!

Reviews.Author: Laurie
Reviews.Content: Still consistently amazing. I bring all my visitors here for something new. No complaints, was a hit by all friends who never had real Ramen before....and no the little cheap salty  processed Ramen packs from grocery are nowhere near the same. If that is what you think, then you need to visit Fukumimi.

Reviews.Author: Dennis
Reviews.Content: Tried to get into this place 12/17. Too crowded to get in wihtin 30 minute; take out was going to take just as long as they wouldn't bother taking my order while seated customers were waiting for their previously orders dishes. Left without ordering. I can only guess that the food  was great from the long waits experienced.

Reviews.Author: Sherry
Reviews.Content: WOW. i've striked the gold in vegas. this ramen spot is pretty darn amaze.  super tranquil tonkotsu soup with a hint of graceful spice for the tan tan mein. Owned and run by Japanese chiefs and owners, this ramen spot is a must eat. it's a little ways off the strip, but its a great escape from the glutinous buffets of heart attacks.

Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: Fast service, fresh ingredients. I had the Miso ramen and my girlfriend had the salt ramen. Amazing! We'll definitely be back for more.

Reviews.Author: Toby
Reviews.Content: Definitely THE ramen place of town! Hands down my favorite. The broth here is not too salty, but also not too flavorless.  Downside - located on the East side near UNLV, so a bit of the drive for anyone not in that area. Also the venue is quite small so expect to wait if you're going around dinner time (especially on a weekend). Generally speaking, the waits aren't too long. I think the most I ever had to wait was 20~25 minutes but we were a party of 6 in such a teeny place.  Do note this place does include a bar so you have the option to sit there if no tables are available. :)  Onto the food... Well, I've tried just about every ramen plate on this menu that is not labelled spicy and I like each and every one. I personally prefer thin noodles over the thick ones, so you may notice some bias in my favorite dishes (hint: they're all thin noodles). Luckily one of the menus on the table should list out what is thin and what is thick.  My favorite dishes in order: 1. Kogashi - the menu describes this as a fragrant flavored ramen and that is 100% true. Drinking the broth side by side with the other flavors, this ramen broth has a strong flavor which I personally prefer. It is topped with fragrant garlic oil and fried onion. My favorite. If you like garlic-y and onion-y flavors, I bet you this is your favorite too (but trust me, it isn't overpowering and still delish) 2. Tonkotsu - I prefer the soy over the salt one (though the salt one is good too). This is simply but very delicious. Again, I like Fukumimi because unlike other ramen places, the broth is not TOO salty, but at the same time, it still has enough flavor to enjoy! 3. Fukumimi Ramen - they say this is their most popular dish (maybe because it's the name of their restaurant?) Either way, I do like this!   This place has a stamp card for loyal guests and you are rewarded with free karaage which is Japanese fried chicken (with lemon juice) and it is also very delicious!

Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: I tried their Tan Tan Men for the first time ever, but the broth was really rich and definitely one of my favorites. I always stopped by here whenever I go to Vegas, one of good things here is also that they open all day from lunch thru dinner. Most of restaurant in Vegas (especially in Casinos) they have break between lunch and dinner.  Their fried chicken is pretty good, and you can get one free fried chicken if you collect 4 stamps for each Ramen ordered. Is highly recommended Ramen place in Vegas.

Reviews.Author: Burke
Reviews.Content: There were eight of us and we all got a different dish and appetizers.  It was all very good.  Rice bowls were tasty though nothing special other than the flavor.  Ramen was good.  They made fried chicken and it was amazing.  It is a very small place so for a large group it could be difficult.

Reviews.Author: Chloe
Reviews.Content: I have been here like every other week, they have good quality of food and they have stamp card. Love this place very much!!

Reviews.Author: Melissa
Reviews.Content: This place is really good especially for the price. Not the best ramen I've had but the place, food and service are always consistent.

Reviews.Author: Edd
Reviews.Content: Definitely recommend this place. First time walked in and was greeted with sincerity. Not the fanciest looking place but im more attracted to the food and service. I will definitely be back to try more of their menu.

Reviews.Author: Winnie
Reviews.Content: I orderd Tonkutsu Ramen (Spicy) with thin noodles...the broth so good and yummy belly pork. Also, Karaage chicken was so delicious but Gyoza just so so.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany
Reviews.Content: Can we say SUPER DELICIOUS RAMEN! We came here as our last stop before leaving vegas to go back home and honestly this was a great  hangover cure ! It made me feel so much better :] The soup base is very clean and not too heavily salted, which is what I like. Usually some places I always ask them to give me low salt, just cause sometimes you feel like you're drinking salt water. The ramen was also very tasty and chewy! I like their decor it was simple and clean! I like that they only have a handful of things to choose from, so you know everything is all their specialty. Not some jumbo mumbo put together ramen. Service was also great and on spot! Definitely would come here again if I'm in vegas and feeling that ramen mood! ^^

Reviews.Author: Mindy
Reviews.Content: I am not a ramen connoisseur, but I do like it, and my daughters love it. That being said, I thought Fukumimi was the best ramen I've had in town (better than Monta!). They had a wider variety of broths than most, including chicken, miso, salt, and spicy. I really appreciated the lighter flavor of the chicken ramen for a change of pace, and the chicken that came in the soup was really good, not fatty and  blobby  like some chicken in restaurants is. Prices are average for ramen - $7-8 per bowl. Ambiance is seriously almost exactly the same as Monta Chaya further south on Eastern, with a long bench, wood paneling and a decent-size bar. As expected, our orders came out pretty fast. Service was friendly and efficient. It doesn't really matter to me because I like what I like, but my husband was very impressed with the number of Japanese people (even Japanese-speaking) that were dining with us. So maybe Fukumimi is pretty close to the real thing?

Reviews.Author: Sharon
Reviews.Content: I am so in love with Fukumimi!   Quick lunch or dinner... Afternoon snack or After Dinner Snack. Anytime is a good time to dine here. With   Fukumimi offers ten choices of Ramen bowls!   Tonkotsu Ramen broth is the house original pork flavored soup base, rich and smooth. They are topped with  chashu pork belly, seasoned egg cooked medium, green onion and fresh bean sprouts. Bowls in this category ranges $7.50-$9.50. My favorite is the Kara-miso Ramen ($8.50) because I like spicy soup! This delicious broth is thicker than the others, blended with miso and bean paste, topped with corn kernels . My kids love Tonkotsu Ramen ( miso), broth is thinner as well as the Tonkotsu Ramen (spicy) ..both at $8.20 a bowl.  The house also offers chicken ramen. Each bowl is topped with seasoned egg? Green onion and bean sprouts. There are only two selections in this category. The Tori Ramen is flavored with a salt based sauce, topped with chicken cha shu and garlic oil. Then there is the Classic Ramen bowl in which the broth is flavored with soy sauce, topped with pork belly cha shu. They go for $7.50.  We like supplementing our meals with: Karaage chicken $3.90  (two thumbs) Honey Garlic Chicken $4.90 (two thumbs)  Gyoza $4.90 stuffed with pork and chicken Agedashi $3.90   Don't forget to get frequent dining card. For every five bowls of ramen, you get a free appetizer!  Great place, great food, great prices!

Reviews.Author: Walter
Reviews.Content: Tonight I had the tonkatsu spicy miso and the tan tan men with the honey garlic chicken. I thought the broth was pretty good and I say this cause I had better broths; more flavorful, with a slightly richer broth, with a house-made black garlic oil and garlic chips on top - a house blend of chili sauce and fresh chili for those who love their broth extra spicy. This would have made it more flavorful.  The honey garlic chicken was just ok, nothing really special. I would recommend they cook the chicken to well done then cooking with deep fried batter. And not to just use plan mayo, but to flavor their mayo blended with sweet and spicy chili sauce. I've had this prepared before and it was again more flavorful.  That's the reason I only rated it a 4/5 stars. I've had the same at these bistros before and better and this is my reason I couldn't rate it a 5.   But overall I'd come again.

Reviews.Author: elmer
Reviews.Content: Quality of food is great portions are small not a good value for the cost. Service could have been better , I ordered an appetizer and it was served with my meal, drinks were never refilled.  Ambience is great , small dining area that reflects the product. If you want ramen in the vegas area try ramen sora

Reviews.Author: Larissa
Reviews.Content: So my friends and I arrived 7 minutes before opening, we opened the door and a lady promptly pushed us out. No big deal, but another party came and the same thing happened. So, it's now 2 minutes to opening and we hear a distinct click of a lock - no one else had tried to breach the entry.   So now it's 3 minutes after opening and they still haven't unlocked the door. I should have suggested that we leave and go somewhere else, but I was hungry. She finally opens the door, we're seated and given tap water - gross.   The food was okay, small portions don't really do it for me. I did enjoy the agedashi tofu, but everything was basic, nothing special.   I won't find myself returning. I can understand not wanting us in before opening, but to lock the door 2 minutes prior to opening and then opening late when you have at least 12 people waiting outside, is not good customer service.

Reviews.Author: Yeanne
Reviews.Content: I've had to keep making myself come back here because the first experience was meh - but I'm completely satisfied with this place right now and keep it in mind whenever I'd like to a have a bowl of ramen  All the appetizers are completely nomz - my couple favorites are the honey garlic chicken, the chicken karaage and the gyoza - pick any of these and you're good to go.  One ramen bowl that particularly stands out would be the Spicy Ramen - just the right hint of spice and flavor but not overpowering enough to where you can't finish the bowl without coughing throughout the whole meal - I'd recommend this bowl if you do like spicy.  However, each time I come here, I hardly ever leave full in the stomach but it absolutely hits the spot every time and I do leave satisfied. Prices per bowl are around $7.xx to $8.95  Would recommend, go check it out!

Reviews.Author: Ayesha
Reviews.Content: PROS: -Good service and decent prices.  FOOD 2/5: -Tonkotsu Ramen Miso ($8.20): The ramen did not taste like authentic Japanese ramen. It didn't have a good broth and it tasted water down.  -Fukumimi Ramen ($9.50): Same as the other ramen, just didn't have good flavors. The broth is supposed to be the foundation of the soup and it didn't serve justice at this place. -Honey Garlic Chicken ($4.50): Ok this was good karage, and I enjoyed the honey flavor.  CONS: -The Ramen.

Reviews.Author: Josh
Reviews.Content: Been meaning to try this place out for a little while now. So after hitting the gym on a Wednesday night, decided ramen was what the tummy craved.   Came in about 730ish and the place is tiny. 8 tables and 6 bar seats. It was about half full, was greeted briefly at the door and took a seat. The server offered drinks and then have enough time and space to look over the menu. Most of it sounded line ramen from any of the other ramen place in town.  I asked for a suggestion and asked if I like spicy. I do, do I was recommended the karo-miso spicy ramen. Also ordered the Soboro bowl. Both items came out really quick. The bowl was rice with ground meat with onions and scallions. It was tasty. Savory with a touch of sweet.  I like spicy food a lot, and many times restaurants that say their food is spicy, it doesn't hit the spot, however this ramen has a good kick. It isn't Hannah or anything, but enough that extra spice isn't necessary. The broth is rich and flavorful, not too salty. The noodle itself has a nice bite to it. Was once told that good ramen should have a elastic spring when you bite it. Which these definitely do.  Lastly the prices are decent. Definitely will return. For the location it is in and the size out would be misleading to judge by looks. People were coming and going the last 20+ minutes I've been here.

Reviews.Author: Stella
Reviews.Content: If you are a big fan of Monta or Ramen Sora, this place doesn't quite meet your expectations. Everything from the food to service was average or needed a lot of work. Needless to say, if you live on the east side of town I definitely respect the practicality of frequenting this place to have your ramen fix, but I'd say the trip to Monta or Ramen Sora will be worth it in the end.

Reviews.Author: Noah
Reviews.Content: Super yummy. Excellent service. Nice couple beers. Small place, but highly recommend for a nice dinner. Would be 5 stars if they had dessert, but ice cream place next door.

Reviews.Author: Mark O
Reviews.Content: Ordered the Fukumimi ramen----very delicious. Will come back again for more. The Chashu bowl is great too.

Reviews.Author: Juan
Reviews.Content: Like the place. Although when they are closed the place looks bigger. But its small and cossie; I like that. I do feel they need something more inside. Not so much more as in having tons of pictures/ornaments, but just enough to keep the same feel for the place and not lose the feel how it looks inside. Maybe a picture or two of a flower. I don't know if anyone else has ever thought of this but I felt like the cooks and the rest of the small staff had a great working relationship. I just felt that because I sat in the bar rather than the tables.     I had the spidy miso ramen. The noddles tasted good! Wish it had more. The chilli taste was not so hot, but good cause I just came out of work and it was the first day of the new year where it was pretty hot outside, so I was not looking forward to start sweating, but also I do not want something without spice. Great taste tho. Nice presentation of the dish. Place is clean and no irritating kids.

Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: I've lived in NY, SF, and LA and would have never thought that Vegas would have good Ramen.  Many LV restaurants, especially by big name Chefs, have failed to impress me but this place is the real deal.  It was inexpensive, service was great, and the Ramen tasted authentic. I found this place on my last visit to Vegas.  I had an hour to kill before my flight and decided to give it a try.   It's in a very plain shopping mall, like all good food is in LV (see Lotus of Siam), and the shop is small.    I got the Fukumimi Ramen and the Soboro Bowl.  Ramen was great, pork was tender and broth was flavorful.  The Soboro bowl was also good but a little too sweet for me.  I'm glad I tried it but will probably try another bowl next time.

Reviews.Author: Aurora
Reviews.Content: I have to say, the food was so so good! I have found my new favorite Noodle house. The service was great and quick. The menu was simple to the point and very descriptive.

Reviews.Author: Lisa
Reviews.Content: Before today, I didn't get it. My idea of ramen was of the six cent variety. When I went to Japan this year, I knew to avoid Ramen because it was pork-based, and I never went to Monta or Sora because I was told the point of ramen is pork broth. As everyone would guess, my inability to try a tasty Japanese dish is rather difficult.  I just assumed it was noodles and broth with lots of sodium.  However, upon learning Fukumimi had chicken ramen, I knew I could finally taste what the excitement is all about. After proctoring the LSAT today, I worked up quite an appetite and headed over to Fukumimi.  I ordered the chicken ramen and not long after, the chef brought out to me a steaming bowl. The bowl was a huge amount, with broth, noodles, chicken  chasiu , bean sprouts, negi (green onions), and a half egg.  This chicken broth would make a Jewish grandmother's toes curl!  It was sooooo flavorful.  I have had my chicken soup training (my aunt told me it would make me marriageable) but mine does not have this richness. The broth itself is a star, but with the noodles, sliced chicken, green onions, sprouts, and the soy-soft boiled egg, it is truly a great balanced meal.  The noodles were the perfect texture, and I added some shichimi to add some spice to the bowl. I saved the egg for the end, and it was perfectly cooked.  I love eggs like this!  This was truly OISHI!  The chef told me he is from Kyoto, so we talked about Kyoto and I showed him a few pictures from when I visited this May. Chicken ramen with tax is only $8.11.  If you are like me and prefer that pigs fly rather than sizzle, this is the only spot in town to indulge in ramen.  The restaurant itself is quaint and clean, the staff is very friendly, and the food is yum (though my options are limited!) - they gave me a stamp card so for every 4 bowls of ramen I buy, I get a free kara-age (or you pork eaters get a free gyoza). Now that I had it  as is  I can add corn and seaweed to it when I am a tad hungrier :)

Reviews.Author: Joseph
Reviews.Content: The Tonkotsu has better flavors then Monta in my opinion and the wait is short which I like. get a stamp card eat 4 bowls get a Gyoza or Karaage free. It's a plus that it's on my side of town.

Reviews.Author: Daniel A
Reviews.Content: If you are a ramen fan this a must. First the ramen is $7.50 and that includes an egg. What a deal and on top of that it's good ramen. Lots of extras you can order if it's not on the menu just ask they will accommodate. It small homely looking place but well worth it. When I go to eat I like to pay for food first then decore.

Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: Food: tonkotsu shoyu ramen with thick noodles. Thick noodles is a must as the regular noodles don't seem like ramen noodles. They are too thin, more like a somen noodle. Gyoza was authentic.   Service: fast and efficient.   Location: in a strip mall.

Reviews.Author: Erik
Reviews.Content: Food was good,  saboro bowl and Japanese fried chicken. Teeny bit overpriced...but the food definitely lived up to the 4 stars, solid 4 from me one less star for no lunch special and for chicken not having dipping options other than this awesome (but easily overdone) salt (msg?) lol. Lower prices or lunch special, more options for chicken dipping and you will get 5 all day

Reviews.Author: Crystal
Reviews.Content: Stumbled upon this place and I couldn't be happier. I come every friday and everything I have had here has been great. I've tried other Raman places in town and this one blows them out of the water. The staff is super friendly and the prices are very reasonable.

Reviews.Author: Jay
Reviews.Content: Unbelievably good ramen. I had the spicy tonkotsu ramen, very well balanced.  The kimchi side was uniquely delicious. There is a hint of sweetness, great texture and the spiciness is just right.  The real treat was the karaage. This is quite possibly some of the best karaage I've ever had. The very best was years ago, and my memory may be lying. There is a loyalty system where you get a free karaage side every 4 bowls of ramen ordered. A fantastic deal. I can't imagine ever eating here and not having the karaage.  My 4 year old loved their curry. It had a great taste and wasn't too spicy.  The interior is clean and tidy. Like most ramen places it isn't very large. It's a comfortable area, and the location is pretty convenient for most spots in the valley.

Reviews.Author: Ponn Mai
Reviews.Content: During a visit to Vegas, I followed a review on Yelp to this Ramen shop because the food at the strip are overrated and overpriced.    What can I say?  It's hard to find a good Ramen place anywhere in the States.  But, let me tell you, I was a bit amaze at this place.  It's no more than 2 miles from the Vegas Strip and the Ramen was really good.  This place must be one of the best Ramen shop I had in the States.  The Chef and waitress remind me of eating Ramen in Japan.  Upon arrival, we were greeted with a friendly greet.  Sat at our table and ordered Ramen.     They put pork in almost all of their Ramen, I ordered the Spicy Ramen and asked the pork to be placed on the side and I gave it to a friend (I'm not a pork guy).  The Ramen soup was flavorful and it wasn't too spicy and salty.  The noodle was pretty good as well, it wasn't too chewy but I was hoping it would snap in my mouth as i chew and the feeling of a traditional Chinese hand pulled noodle.  The price was about 8 dollars, and you'll finish your noodle fairly quickly so I recommend asking for more noodle.  But nonetheless, the Ramen was amazingly good.    I highly recommend this place to anyone who is visit Vegas.

Reviews.Author: Yvette
Reviews.Content: Shortly after landing in Las Vegas, our bellies were rumbling with curiosity to see what the city had to offer. We looked on yelp for nearby restaurants and chose Fukumimi because the answer to ramen is always yes.  Walked in to see a small, intimate restaurant with a couple of tables. We ate during off-peak hour but I can imagine it gets crowded quickly. My 3 friends and I were seated right away and started with chicken karaage and agedashi tofu as appetizers. Both were really good! The chicken was super juicy and crisp. Although we couldn't tell if it was the red light from the store sign reflecting off the meat or if it was slightly undercooked- we just ate it because it was tasty.   I ordered the Tan Tan, which did not fulfill my ramen craving. It was a little too creamy for me, with a peanut aftertaste. I normally love all noodles+broth, but this broth didn't hit the spot. My boyfriend really liked it though so we ended up switching our bowls. He ordered the Fukumimi which in my opinion was a lot better. The broth was lighter and I enjoyed it more.   Parking here is no issue because the restaurant is inside a huge mall complex. Staff is attentive and service is good. Overall, our party agreed it is more 3 stars than 4 stars on yelp. We got the top 3 popular ramen off the menu and they were all okay.

Reviews.Author: Angel
Reviews.Content: I love fukumimi!   Every time I come the staff is super helpful. Twice now I've brought children. Once an infant with my cousin and today with my two year old niece.  The waitress brought a princess cup and spoon for my niece! It was over the top for me in service. After the second time I know they do it for all the kids but really a sweet touch. Bringing toddlers to a restaurant makes me feel bad but they seem to welcome the idea.   They have the best chicken kaarage in town IMO which they serve with a too small side salad with amazing ginger dressing.    Their curry isn't the best, but still good. The chashu bowl was also good, but not the best.  The flavors of all of the dishes aren't super salty. Everything is very light.   Even after having my entire bowl of the house fukumimi ramen (which I always get) and karaage I felt satisfied but not overly stuffed.   The prices are reasonable. Everything is under $10 dollars.  The fukumimi house ramen $9.50 comes with all the fixings (seaweed, 3 slices of pork, oil) so that's what I get and add corn.   For the good prices, awesome service, and cleanliness I give them all five stars   Most recent visit today I noticed their addition of a few more appetizers and ramen to their updated menus! They use agedashi tofu in soy broth! I believe it was $3.90 The chicken karaage is $3.90 and the gyoza are $4.90 which they let you mix your own ratio of gyoza sauce and chili oil.   The appetizers are made to order I am about 95% sure of.

Reviews.Author: Amanda
Reviews.Content: This is the best little place to get a BIG bowl of ramen for a really great price! I love this place so much, I had my birthday dinner here and love to get it to go on busy nights. The tonkotsu ramen is amazing and the karage is so yummy! If you want REAL ramen this is the place to go. Don't pay for over priced ramen at Monta.

Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: If you are a person who puts Tapatio in regular ramen you NEED TO STOP EVERYTHING AND EAT AT THIS RAMEN RESTAURANT!  They can add 'Spicy' to most ramen dishes, which is amazingly good. Also since no one knows about this place, it's generally not busy but IT'S SO GOOD.  WAIT. I'M NOT DONE.   If you are a person that enjoys salty foods and fried chicken  GET THE KARAAAGE!!!!  It blows away every single piece of chicken I have ever eaten. Watch out though, its very hot (temperature wise).  UPDATE!!  One day my boyfriend was sick. He was nauseated and not feeling good and was unable to eat most of the day. He was feeling really bad. I, being a good girlfriend, picked up Shoyu Ramen at Fukumimi. I thought he would only eat a little bit. I ordered it takeout and brought it to him. I mixed it up for him and he ate all of it. The next day he was back to normal and eating. I was amazed at the power of Shoyu Ramen from Fukumimi. It was like giving my boyfriend a Phoenix Down.

Reviews.Author: Heather
Reviews.Content: Visited this place one night by word of mouth. I've been to a few Ramen joints but this by far has the most flavorful broth and different concoctions. I can appreciate the several choices they have on their menu. It's a bit of a drive for us but we will definitely be repeat customers. I highly recommend the Fukumimi spicy with the large noodles. This will satisfy your ramen craving! Wish I had a bowl right now!!

Reviews.Author: Linda
Reviews.Content: 3rd Ramen house in 10 days and now thinking I have a serious addiction problem. We had the mother-in-law with us, who's been on a strict low sodium diet, so what better way to mess with her than take her to a Ramen house ...pure evil.  I was intrigued by the Tan Tan Men (I prefer Tan Tan Women...groan, I know). Since starting this Ramen quest of mine, I've started to experiment at home with making my own version of Tan Tan (Wo)Men. I was curious how Fukumini's meat compared to Sora's and mine. The flavor profiles of all 3 are very similar with tasting the likeness of Toban Djan (Chili Bean Sauce), sweetness from Mirin and hints of garlic. I think my recipe is pretty close. Service was excellent and on point. We arrived just before the dinner rush and were seated right away. There was a bit of anxiety on our part during the first few minutes of walking in as the aromas permeating  were quite unpleasant and offensive. But the poopy odor soon dissipated and were replaced by more pleasant cooking bouquets. We started with an order of GYOZA which was the best I've had. It was well seasoned and something better than any of the dumplings I've had in Chinatown. The TAN TAN MEN was delicious! Flavorful rich broth that wasn't too salty and thick noodles that had a nice chew to them. My bowl was the envy of everyone at my table who ordered other varieties such as the Classic Ramen in a chicken based broth and the Tonkatsu Soy Ramen. Fortunately for my MIL, they offered a low sodium version of each broth to save her from sporting kankles. My wife who is a picky eater, which is why I suggested the Classic Ramen, wanted to switch with my bowl of Tan Tan Men after tasting it. Being the picky eater, she gives me her Chashu so I thought it would be a win/win situation. We will probably be back sooner than later so she can get her Tan Tan Women.  The Chashu was very tender. My daughter didn't enjoy her Tonkatsu Soy Ramen as much because she said it wasn't as well seasoned, but getting her nana's accidental order of extra Chashu made up for it. I think Fukumini will be a regular spot for us to hit up on cold nights since it's on our side of town and similar to Ramen Sora. Oishii desu!

Reviews.Author: Joanne
Reviews.Content: Oishii! Would've given them 5 stars however my friend kindly requested no green onions and well...maybe it slipped her mind but there were tons of green onion in her ramen. When trying ramen for the first time I always taste the broth first. And this broth was delicious! I believe I got the regular tonkatsu ramen and was thoroughly pleased. We got there right before the rush and the other waitresses were really nice. All in all, I would come back. I also had their japanese curry, which I found to be really good as well. Comparable to curry house back home in Hawaii. Is it better than Monta? I'm not sure, Monta's fried rice and ramen combo packs a one two punch one that Fukumimi can't beat.

Reviews.Author: Joaquin
Reviews.Content: A very limited menu and small space, but that's all you need. This is glorious soup and noodles in a bowl, and not much else, which is absolutely fine. The best ramen in Las Vegas. They're all pretty good, but the spicy miso ramen is probably my favorite.

Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a great ramen spot in Vegas, Fukumimi is the place to go! It's a small but very cozy, family-owned restaurant that provides quality service and food at great prices. They stay busy all day, everyday. Your order is ready within minutes and they even have a stamp card that will keep you coming back. I'm a regular at this restaurant and my favorite soup is the Kogashi Ramen soup. Definitely recommend it for all the  Ramen lovers .

Reviews.Author: Yahira
Reviews.Content: Stopped by at the suggestion of a ramen-loving, foodie friend. Fukumimi does not disappoint! I had the Tonkatsu Ramen (Miso) with seaweed. The broth was rich in flavor, but not heavy and in my opinion not as salty as Monta's Miso Ramen. I ate every last bite.    The dude ordered the Tonkatsu Ramen (Spicy) and an order of Karaage Chicken. His broth was also full of flavor, but not overwhelming, and the spice level was just right. Didn't try the Karaage, but the crisp looked great and it smelled wonderful...And that's coming from someone who doesn't generally the smell of chicken.   The atmosphere was busy, but not too loud even with every table taken. Our server was friendly, polite and pretty attentive considering how busy it was. The place is small, but clean.   We'll be back!

Reviews.Author: Justine
Reviews.Content: Great place!   Everyone was friendly, fast service, excellent flavors, reasonable prices.   First we ordered the honey garlic chicken. We soon fought over the last piece.  I got the ramen with the same name as the restaurant. I liked it. Lots of pork. Filling and tasty. They covered the inside of the bowl in seaweed. The noodles weren't too soft. Good ramen.  Will got the one with the ground pork. The pork was sweet seasoned and it was a good contrast. The broth was creamy and savory. It had a little spice. He added the marinated egg and it had plenty of flavor too. The thick noodles had a great texture too.   We thanked the kitchen as we left and they all yelled happily back. If we lived nearby we might be regulars here.   Eat here, it's a gem!

Reviews.Author: Jenny
Reviews.Content: Heard about this place from some friends so finally had an opportunity to try it!  Of course I ordered PORK BELLY. We also had Karaage, a side of Kimchi, a pork belly bowl aaaand another ramen but I can't think of the name of it now! It wasn't that great anyway... The Karaage (FRIED CHICKEN for those of you who DON'T know WTH I am talking about!) was really good! Juicy and awesome. I think they put extra sauce on the kimchi, it is REALLY good tho. NOM for sure! And my pork belly ramen was on point as well! Tender pork and delicious broth. NOM NOM NOM.

Reviews.Author: A
Reviews.Content: I love this place. Ramen is good, gyoza is good, everything I've tried was delicious. Only one thing I'm not happy about is the service.

Reviews.Author: Lexus
Reviews.Content: I've seen many pictures of Fukumimi Ramen from my coworker's and heard good reviews about them. I was really craving ramen because I thought about Naruto ramen and was roaming around Yelp. It's on Eastern and Tropicana, when you walk in the interior was very small (smaller than Monta on Spring Mountain and Decatur).  SERVICE We were greeted right away and arrived around 1:20pm. They were kind of busy but not packed/no line. It took around a few minutes to be seated and received drinks immediately. Waitress was nice and patient because my party was not sure which broth they wanted to get. But overall good service.  FOOD I ordered the Kara-miso Ramen (Spicy Miso) with thick noodles. By its appearance, the broth looks spicy but it was not as spicy as I thought it would be. Compared to other ramen places in Las Vegas the broth is actually spicy, other places just put a ton of spicy powder to make it  spicy . The ramen I ordered came with pork belly chashu, seasoned eggs, green onion, and sprouts PLUS corn (Kara-miso came with corn, what a bonus and it's delicious).  CONCLUSION I will be back to try different tonkotsu broths they offer, but I wish their portions were a little bit bigger (especially the rice bowls). Good food, good service.

Reviews.Author: Christopher
Reviews.Content: A welcome addition to the ramen scene on the east side of town.  Located in an inconspicuous strip mall at the corner of Tropicana and Eastern, this is a true neighborhood ramen joint where one is always greeted enthusiastically at the door and local Japanese residents can always be spotted as regulars.  The decor is minimalist but modern and service is prompt and non-overbearing.    Appetizers that stand out are the karaage (Japanese fried chicken) and the gyoza (pork/chicken pot stickers).  The chicken is served fresh out of the fryer with a nice crispy exterior and juicy interior with a hint of ginger accentuated with a squeeze of fresh lemon whereas the gyoza have a nice char and the dough skin and filling are light enough to leave room for the main course.    After consuming 15+ bowls of ramen on multiple lunch break visits from work, the key words describing the soups here are consistency and balance.  Whereas I've had a few instances at Ramen Sora and Monta where the soups were either too salty or too bitter (black garlic oil was literally blackened garlic),  the broths here all have a creamy rich depth of flavor and are not overly cloying in the mouth so the resistance to reaching for additional spoonfuls of broth once the noodles are finished is quite low.  Noodles come in thick and thin varieties with decent texture although lacking any true inherent flavor only found at the top joints.    The standout broth for me is one of the relative newcomers on the menu: the kogashi (or burnt miso) ramen.  I've waxed poetic before on the Mallard reaction in chemistry  applied to food in a previous review(nerd alert!) but here again is yet another example of the magical powers of applying heat to rearrange amino acids and simple sugars to create a new unique flavor.  By charring miso paste, not only is there an intense aroma given off by the broth upon arriving at your table, but the flavor profile retains the savory note of the fermented soybeans we all know and love in miso but also has additional complex notes with an almost caramelized sweetness and a hint of bitterness that is pleasing on the tongue.  The crispy fried onions topping the noodles further enhance the umami tsunami.   I wish I could comment on the tan-tan men (spicy Szechuan style broth), but alas my first experience was on a full stomach from a previous meal so I must defer one to read other fellow yelper's raves on this other unique offering.  For the most part, the choices here are safe and reliably consistent, much like dating the girl next door, but if you're in the mood for something a little more adventuresome and unpredictable, the krazy kogashi ramen or the spicy and fiery tan tan men are worthy  fuku-mi-mi  one night stands (had to do it,  the name of the joint is just begging for a little humorous acknowledgment!)    P.S.  Don't forget to partake in their generous punch-card system where one is entitled to a free order of gyoza or karaage with every fourth bowl of ramen purchased!

Reviews.Author: Shirley
Reviews.Content: Ramen..aka soul food Japanese style! After seeing it popup on the Yelp radar and reading some of the rave reviews from Tetsuro P. & Ursula U (who told me to get my butt over here)..Well I just had to see for myself.  I have to say this ramen house is on the path to being the cream of the crop! Now I know that 101 ways to make ramen doesn't qualify me as the noodle connoisseur, but compared to others noodle houses I've tried, hands down, Fukumimi rocks!    Location: End corner of strip mall on Eastern/Tropicana ..plenty of parking spaces. A big plus for those of us whose home base is here in Henderson.     Service/Atmosphere - A - The restaurant staff enthusiastically greeted us in Japanese as we stepped inside.  It was almost a full house when we arrived during the dinner hour, but we were seated right away. The hostess also did double duty as our server.  Friendly and pretty efficient considering how busy the place was. The small dining area was simple interior, single seating at the high top top counter facing the kitchen and tables of two lined back against the wall set close together. So close that nosy me got to see and question the party next to me on what dish she ordered that looked so good, which was the Fukumimi ramen.   Food:  A+  - Prices: fair most under $10  We ordered the Fukumimi Ramen, Karaage & Curry/rice bowl.   Both Karaage & Curry bowl were very good, for the low price hard not to pass up either.  The Fukumimi - THE BEST!! This order is pretty large portion. The bowl width is average size, but deep in depth. It looked like a gourmet bowl of ramen, a pretty visual presentation. Seaweed lined half of the bowl filled with hot and steamy broth.  The tonkotsu (pork) broth ; perfect! It was packed with flavor, had a brown milky color, rich and creamy.  The thin noodles were delish and cooked to the right texture. Toppings: slices pork belly, tender, 1/2 of soft boiled egg, sprouts added some crunch and the scallions boosted the flavor even more. I want to say it's garlic infused oil, black in color that was drizzled on top as well.  This was such a delicious hearty meal.  This place is most definatley yummy for your tummy!

Reviews.Author: Crystal
Reviews.Content: This place is small and doesn't look like much but the food was seriously on point! One of the best ramen I've ever eaten. Price was a bonus. My family and I loved everything we ordered and plan to visit next time we're in Vegas. Oh and the staff was really friendly!

Reviews.Author: Devin
Reviews.Content: It's hard to find really good Ramen in Las Vegas, but this is the place. I've only had two of the dishes thus far, the chicken and beef. But so far so good. Nice when you don't want to venture into Chinatown.

Reviews.Author: Louie
Reviews.Content: Always a great choice! Was packed tonight & everything was spot on! Service, quality not to mention everything came out really fast! Shout out to Lauren for being a proactive host.  Exceptional all around!

Reviews.Author: Tiffany
Reviews.Content: So there are tons of Ramen Noodle Houses in the Las Vegas area but Fukumimi is the best in town (hands down!)  I'm going to keep it simple: -Best Broth -Kid Friendly -Great Service -Best Chicken Karaage w/ salt  YUM YUM YUM!

Reviews.Author: Jp
Reviews.Content: Been here about 5 times and the two times I'm here I ordered my Karaage Chicken SUPER GREASY and I mention it to the server then she said no it is the salad dressing and the chicken suppose to be GREASY NOT CRUNCHY! I was politely ask to fix my Karaage issues but she come back with the same chicken saying I will just take it off the check instead of fixing it correctly!!! The owner is not here by the way!!! VERY DISAPPOINTING, NOT SURE IF IM GOING TO RETURN TO THIS PLACE AGAIN!!!

Reviews.Author: Mali
Reviews.Content: My first time having ramen . It's a small place probably seats about 30 people max . The ramen was delicious . My Japanese friend took me and he said the ramen reminds him of Japan ! So I know it's legit .   We started off with karaage , agedashi tofu , and gyoza . Everything tasted really good ! I had the miso ramen and he had the fukumimi ramen which is their most ordered ramen . The fukumimi comes with more meat it's a better value .

Reviews.Author: Yuanliang
Reviews.Content: We visited this place everyday when we were in Las Vegas. I think the Fukumimi ramen tastes even better than those famous ramens in LA!!! Everything is perfect here.

Reviews.Author: Kelly
Reviews.Content: Classic Tomkotsu Ramen noodle taste. Reasonable price. Wait time 5 min. Small and cozy place.

Reviews.Author: Teresa
Reviews.Content: Several ramen choices, all pretty good. Tan tan man is a tiny bit spicy, nothing really, if you like spicy. Great flavor & good portion. Reasonable prices on appetizers & a loyalty card for regular customers. Free appetizer with full card (1 punch for every ramen bowl)  Small dining area, interesting  place. Restroom could use a little freshen up but overall cleanliness is acceptable. Staff is friendly & efficient.

Reviews.Author: Maureen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had our first ramen experience here and we really enjoyed it.  This is a small restaurant with quick and friendly service.  It was a Monday night and the place was crowded.  We both had the Fukumimi special, thick noodles, and my husband ordered his spicy.  It was served with a generous portion of pork belly and green onions, half an egg and garlic oil.  We had gyoza and kimchi as appetizers, both very well prepared.  Highly recommend for a quick tasty meal or hangover helper. ;)

Reviews.Author: S
Reviews.Content: I haven't always liked ramen but I must say that I really love this place! I try to come atleast once a month since I work over at the airport and its just a 10min drive. My favs are the fukumimi special and their agedashi tofu? Oh my gaaaaaaaaawd.

Reviews.Author: victoria
Reviews.Content: Looking for a quick Japanese ramen fix this is the place...kara miso ramen is the best if you love spicy like me,  fukumimi ramen if your in a mood for the regular one... honey glazed and chicken kaarage are the bomb...  small place so make sure call if you want to know if their busy...

Reviews.Author: E
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended this ramen place. It was my first time. Got the tonkatsu salt ramen and karaage chicken. The pork in the ramen is really juicy and not dry. The chicken was amazing; juicy. It's a reasonable price and it tasted good. Will return next time.

Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: Tasty ramen and very reasonably priced. Extremely small space so if they are busy be prepared to wait a bit, but food comes out quickly.

Reviews.Author: Juan
Reviews.Content: I stumbled across this place by accident really. The first time I saw it I noticed it was in a very seemingly lonely plaza on the corner of Tropicana and Eastern, not really an attention grabber but in my search for some great Japanese ramen I figured I would give it a shot. With my affinity for small mom and pop businesses this was totally a place for me and let me tell you, it didn't disappoint one bit! When I walked it, it had a very welcoming environment. You're greeted as you walk in the door and are told to pick a seat of your liking. A menu is presented, one with few choices but those few choices are there because that is what they specialize in and what you will love even if at first you think you won't. I chose the Japanese fried chicken to start. The seasoning was perfect! Simple seasoning of salt, white pepper, floured then deep fried. Super juicy and tender served along a mixed greens salad with a Japanese vinaigrette. Very tasty! The ramen that I selected was the Tonkatsu Ramen (salt). I am a big fan of this type of ramen so when I ordered it I had very high expectations. The presentation of the ramen was beautiful. The stock was dark and full of flavorful collagen, the pork was cooked to perfection the point of it falling apart in the broth and the half egg on top had a perfectly creamy yolk that any egg lover would die for. The ramen noodles were al dente as well. The base of the ramen was extremely flavorful. You could tasted the love and time that it took to make this delicious dish.  I would gladly visit this restaurant again to try the different types of ramen that they offer. To anyone that is searching for some delicious ramen on the east side of town, definitely go here! You don't have to go to Chinatown to get some great Japanese ramen!

Reviews.Author: Sprinkles
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. The chicken Karaage alone is worth going back for. Had a group of 8 & everyone loved it. Others raved over their Fukumimi Ramen.I had the chicken ramen which was good but not great. I can't wait to go back & try the Fukumimi ramen.

Reviews.Author: Mandi
Reviews.Content: I was deserately craving ramen (as per usual) and decided to give this place a shot since I had heard such great things and had yet to try it.  First of all, the people who work there are so cute and sweet!!  It was a Wednesday night and the restaurant was pretty empty.  It's set up very similar to the other ramen joints: small, with wooden tables and some bar seating.  I got seated right away and ordered the Fukumimi Ramen, which says it come with extra chasyu and nitamago.  The serving was huge and it was absolutely delicious.  The broth was heavenly and just the right amount of saltiness and porkiness.  It didn't taste heavy at all.  The noodles were also perfectly cooked.  The Chasyu was melt in your mouth tender.  The only thing that was surprising was that I only got one half of an egg since I thought the Fukumimi Ramen came with extra egg.    I also ordered the karaage chicken which I thought were just okay.  It's more like chicken breast rather than chicken wings.  Maybe I waited too long to eat them because they weren't all that crunchy on the outside and a tad bit oily.  I would say that this is right up there with Sora.  I haven't been to Sora for at least a month now so I will have to go back soon so I can make a valid comparison.

Reviews.Author: Janet
Reviews.Content: I had the Fukumimi Ramen which was said the best Ramen there, it was too salty for me, and the noodle itself was not so good enough. I was really disappointed because this restaurant has a high rate.

Reviews.Author: Yuhi
Reviews.Content: Fukumimi is so legit. This review is sans all the geographical, technical ramen nonsense and all about the delicious food.  The Karaage is my kind of fried chicken. Lightly breaded, lightly fried, nice and moist. However, maybe it was the batch we got but it seemed under seasoned. Nothing some chili flakes (they didn't have togarashi) and sriracha can't fix but I wonder if the breading was supposed to have more spice? They gave us a frequent diner card that'll get us a free app every few bowls. Without a doubt, karaage will be my choice.  Just saying, whoever designed this menu needs a lesson in menu-writing. And I don't mean graphics! It's totally confusing! There are so many options: Fukumimi Ramen, Tan Tan Men, Shoyu, Shio, Miso, Tonkotsu, blah blah blah. I can totally appreciate options, but there isn't enough description to figure out which one to order. A well-written menu doesn't make you scratch your head; it's supposed to inspire you to eat, well, everything.  With my menu rant over with, I'm back to talking about how much I love the food. After a few questions to the waitress (who was super nice might I add), I finally decided on the Fukumimi Ramen with the Miso broth (you have a choice).  I think the Fukumimi bowl is like your  deluxe  bowl at Sora: half an egg, a couple slices of pork, a few nori, menma, green onion. Then of course you can add any extras you desire.  Broth was rich and flavorful without being too salty. They add black garlic oil at the end which adds even more depth. Noodles aren't as thick as I like but still nice and chewy. I swear, with all these ramen places opening, there are so many different types of charsiu in Vegas now. Their pork is less tender than most places and more chewy. It was also cut really thick. I'm all for delicious pork but because it didn't just melt in your mouth it was a little more difficult to eat.  Fukumimi runs a little east for me. UNLV is as far east as I usually go so I probably won't be here as much as I like. If I'm in the area though, I'm for sure going to try to stop by. It's down the street from my favorite Middle East market by the Liberace Museum so maybe I can work it into my usual hits!

Reviews.Author: Karen
Reviews.Content: The food came out in a very timely manner, and that was the particularly good thing.  I ordered the Tonkotsu Shoyu Ramen, and it was fine.  It was neither amazing nor horrible.  The noodles were served as I asked them to be (extra hard), and the soup was okay.  Overall, I had a very mediocre experience.

Reviews.Author: Gabriel
Reviews.Content: I heard quite a bit about this restaurant and had high hopes for it but unfortunately I was disappoint in the food. Noodles were soggy and I feel like top ramen would have been a far better choice. The service was good which is why I'm rating this 2 stars.

Reviews.Author: Bryant
Reviews.Content: For Vegas, this is my new favorite ramen joint.   The best ramen I've ever had was in Queen's Square, Yokohama, Minato-ke, Japan. So now, all other ramen joints get compared to this experience.  Fukumimi manages to make a excellent tonkotsu (pork) broth that is the best broth in town. I always get the spicy version here, which to me isnt spicy at all, but adds good flavor. (On an asian scale of spice, its like a 2/10).  The charsui (braised tender pork belly), is hit or miss. Sometimes its really tender, and sometimes its not. Monta has better charsui, and it is consistently good..  But overall I like Fukumimi more.  Pros: Great broth Great flavor Affordable Price  Cons: Inconsistency on the char sui Small restaurant (maybe 20-25 seats total).

Reviews.Author: Samantha
Reviews.Content: This place is the best. The pork is perfectly cooked, the soup is light but filling with awesome flavor and the costumer service is great.  They are so welcoming and feels like family.  I go there every Friday with my fianc√©.  The should open one in Henderson :)

Reviews.Author: Olga
Reviews.Content: Really good chashu and tonkatsu pork ramen bowls. Good service and reasonably priced. Will come back!

Reviews.Author: Keiko
Reviews.Content: ËâØÂøÉÁöÑ„Å™„ÅäÂÄ§ÊÆµ„Åß‰∏ÅÂØß„Å™Âë≥„ÅÆÁæéÂë≥„Åó„ÅÑ„É©„Éº„É°„É≥„ÅåÈ£ü„Åπ„Çâ„Çå„Çã„É©„Éº„É°„É≥Â±ã„Åï„Çì„ÄÇ  „Ç¢„É°„É™„Ç´„ÅÆ„É©„Éº„É°„É≥„Å£„Å¶„ÄÅÊó•Êú¨„ÅÆÁõ∏Â†¥„Åã„ÇâËÄÉ„Åà„Çã„Å®Áõ∏ÂΩìÈ´ò„ÅÑ„Å®ÊÄù„ÅÜ„Çì„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ„Åæ„ÅÇ„ÄÅ„Åì„Å£„Å°„ÅßÊú¨Ê†º„É©„Éº„É°„É≥„Å£„Å¶Áèç„Åó„ÅÑ„Çè„Åë„Åß„ÄÅ„Åù„ÅÆ„É¨„Ç¢Â∫¶„Å´Âêà„Çè„Åõ„Å¶ÂÄ§ÊÆµ„ÇÇ‰∏ä„Åå„Çã„Å£„Å¶„ÅÑ„ÅÜ„ÅÆ„ÅØÂàÜ„Åã„Çâ„Çì„Åß„ÇÇ„Å™„ÅÑ„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ„Åß„ÇÇ„ÄÅÊú¨Êù•„ÅÆÁõ∏Â†¥„ÇíÁü•„Å£„Å¶„ÇãËÄÖ„Åã„Çâ„Åô„Çã„Å®„ÄÅ„Åì„ÅÆÂë≥„Åß„Åù„ÅÆÂÄ§ÊÆµ„ÅØ„Å°„Çá„Å£„Å®„Éú„É™„Åô„Åé„Åò„ÇÉ„Å™„ÅÑ„ÅãÔºü„Å®ÊÄù„ÅÜ‰∫ã„ÇÇÁµêÊßã„ÅÇ„ÇãË®≥„ÅßÔºà„É≠„Çπ„ÅÆÊüê„É©„Éº„É°„É≥Â∫ó„Å®„ÅãÔºâ„ÄÇ„Åù„ÅÆÁÇπ„ÄÅ„Åì„ÅÆ„ÅäÂ∫ó„ÅØÊó•Êú¨„ÅÆÁõ∏Â†¥‰æ°Ê†º„Å´ÁµêÊßãËøë„ÅÑÂÄ§ÊÆµ„ÅßÈ†ëÂºµ„Å£„Å¶„Åä„Çâ„Çå„Çã„Çà„ÅÜ„Å´ÊÄù„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ„Åù„Çå„Åß„ÅÑ„Å¶„ÅäÂë≥„ÅØÁµ∂ÂìÅÔºÅ  ‰ªäÂõûÈ†º„Çì„Å†„ÅÆ„ÅØ„ÄÅÁÑ¶„Åå„Åó„É©„Éº„É°„É≥„Å®ÈÜ§Ê≤πË±öÈ™®„ÄÅÈ§ÉÂ≠ê„ÄÅÂîêÊèö„Åí„ÄÇ „É©„Éº„É°„É≥„ÅØ„ÅÑ„Åö„Çå„ÇÇÈ∫∫„ÇíÂ§™È∫∫„Åß„ÅäÈ°ò„ÅÑ„Åó„Åü„Çì„Åß„Åô„Åå„ÄÅ„Åì„Çå„ÅåÊó®„ÅÑÔºÅÂ§™È∫∫Â•Ω„Åç„Å´„ÅØÂ†™„Çâ„Å™„ÅÑ„Éú„É™„Éú„É™ÊÑü„Åå„ÅÇ„Çä„ÄÅ„Åã„Å§„Çπ„Éº„Éó„Åå„Çà„ÅèÁµ°„Åø„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ„Çπ„Éº„Éó„ÅØ„ÄÅÂÄã‰∫∫ÁöÑ„Å´„ÅØÁÑ¶„Åå„Åó„É©„Éº„É°„É≥„Åå„Ç¢„Çø„É™ÔºÅÁÑ¶„Åå„Åó„Éã„É≥„Éã„ÇØ„ÅÆ„Ç≥„ÇØ„Åå„ÄÅ„Çµ„É©„É™„Å®‰Ωú„Çâ„Çå„ÅüË±öÈ™®„Å´„Çà„ÅèÂêà„ÅÑ„ÄÅ„Åè„Å©ÈÅé„Åé„Åö„ÄÅÁ®ã„Çà„ÅÑ„Ç≥„ÇØ„ÇíÈÜ∏„Åó„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇÈÜ§Ê≤πË±öÈ™®„ÅØ„ÄÅË±öÈ™®„ÇíÁ∂∫È∫ó„Å´‰Ωú„Å£„Å¶„ÅÇ„Çã„Åü„ÇÅ„Åã„ÄÅ„ÅÑ„Çè„ÇÜ„ÇãÈÜ§Ê≤πË±öÈ™®„Å®„ÅØÂ∞ë„ÅóÁ≥ªÁµ±„ÅåÈÅï„ÅÜÊ∞ó„Åå„Åó„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇÂÄã‰∫∫ÁöÑ„Å´„ÅØÈÜ§Ê≤πË±öÈ™®„Å´„ÅØ„ÇÇ„ÅÜÂ∞ë„ÅóÈÜ§Ê≤πÊÑü„ÅåÊ¨≤„Åó„ÅÑÊ∞ó„Åå„Åô„Çã„ÅÆ„Åß„Åô„Åå„ÄÅ„Åï„Å£„Å±„ÇäÈ£ü„Åπ„Çâ„Çå„Çã„ÅÆ„ÅØËâØ„ÅÑ„Åã„ÇÇ„Åó„Çå„Åæ„Åõ„Çì„ÄÇ „Çµ„Ç§„Éâ„ÅßÁâπÁ≠Ü„Åô„Åπ„Åç„ÅØÂîêÊèö„Åí„Åß„Åó„Çá„ÅÜ„Åã„ÄÇ„Ç∏„É•„Éº„Ç∑„Éº„ÅßÊúüÂæÖ„ÇíË£èÂàá„Çâ„Å™„ÅÑ„ÄÅÊó•Êú¨„ÅÆÈ≥•„É¢„É¢ÂîêÊèö„Åí„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ„Ç¢„ÉÉ„ÉÑ„Ç¢„ÉÑ„ÅßÁæéÂë≥„Åó„ÅÑÔºÅ  ‰ªñ„Å´„ÅØ„Çπ„Éë„Ç§„Ç∑„ÉºÂë≥Âôå„ÄÅÊãÖ„ÄÖÈ∫∫„Å™„Å©„ÇÇ„ÅÇ„Çã„Çà„ÅÜ„Å™„ÅÆ„Åß„ÄÅ„ÇÇ„Åó„Åæ„Åü„Éô„Ç¨„Çπ„Å´Êù•„ÇãÊ©ü‰ºö„Åå„ÅÇ„Çå„Å∞ÊòØÈùûÊãÖ„ÄÖÈ∫∫„Å´„Éà„É©„Ç§„Åó„Åü„ÅÑ„Å®„Åì„Çç„ÄÇ  „ÅîÈ¶≥Ëµ∞„Åï„Åæ„Åß„Åó„ÅüÔºÅ

Reviews.Author: Patrick
Reviews.Content: 6/7: I've been here several times. The waitresses are always friendly and beautiful here. Top notch service while enjoying a delicious meal! I'm not a big fan of Ramen noodles, so I usually get some sort of appetizer and rice bowl when I visit various Ramen shops.   I always get the Karaage (Japanese fried chicken) here! So fresh, soft, and juicy. Delicious! One of the best food items I've ever had. I love saying Karaage too...such a cool word; I might name my next pet Karaage.   TIP: I don't know if it's regular or seasoned salt that's included, but adding it to the Karaage makes it taste that much better!  Their regular size Chicken Bowl is great as well. I'm a returning customer!

Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: Tasty ramen. I felt it was a little overpriced since i dont think any noodle soup is worth much more than $5 a bowl.  The interior is tiny and cozy and the staff are nice.

Reviews.Author: Rob
Reviews.Content: I have completed 4 stamp cards in this ramen bar, that just means i loved the place and the free Karaage. FUKUMIMI shouldnt i get a loyalty rewards? Just kidding,  This is one of my favourite Japanese Ramen Bar in Las Vegas.  Will definitely go just need one more stamp on my card HAHAHA!

Reviews.Author: Simon
Reviews.Content: One of the best Ramen places in LV.  The soboro Bowl was flavorful and packed a great punch for such a tiny item.  My wife and I were fighting for the last bite.  I enjoyed my Spicy Tonkatsu Ramen.  The noodles were perfect, the bit of pork and the sweetness of the added corn made it heavenly.  When it comes to Ramen Houses, its all about the broth.  It was great!  I highly recommend this Ramen house.

Reviews.Author: Melissa
Reviews.Content: Yum. Still have not had a bad meal here. Fukumimi is still in my top 3 ramen spots! Something new on the menu is the kogashi ramen, which has thin noodles and broth has black garlic oil. Another new menu item is garlic chicken appetizer, which I will have to try next time. The appetizer I always is the kim chi!!! It's different, but I love it...it has a slight sweetness to it. Guess what? Filled up my stamp card! Free gyoza or karaage next time :)

Reviews.Author: Christen
Reviews.Content: I've been to Monta Ramen, Ramen Sora and Ichiza. This place wins above them all! The place looks and feels like authentic Japan. The food is by far the best! Every ramen assortment I've tried has been so tasty and again, authentic!  They have a stamp card, so if you buy 4 ramen bowls, you get a free appetizer! This was easy to get in just one week bc I came back everyday...guilty for this, but so worth it.  I've brought my friends and family, they've all agreed that this is the best place for ramen in Vegas!  P.S. Try the curry bowl, super delicious and just like they make in Japan! I always split a ramen and curry bowl w my husband when we go! Enjoy :)

Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: This is the best ramen in Vegas, IMHO - better than Sora & Monta, and all of the other small ramen shops that dot the Vegas landscape.  The salt tonkotsu ramen is the best dish on the menu, and you can pay a couple of dollars more for the Fukumimi ramen (which is a meatier version with sheets of nori).  The chicken karage is just as delicious, and I honestly do not know how they are able to fry the chicken so delicately and keep it ultra-juicy.  Waitstaff is always awesome and pleasant.    It's a fairly small restaurant and it can get packed pretty quickly, but the food is worth the wait.  Two bowls of ramen with a starter of karage for under $20 makes this meal the best value in the city!

Reviews.Author: Ursula
Reviews.Content: Excuse my language but this place is  F**KIN GOOD !!!!!  I normally do not give 5 stars after a 1st visit but Fukumimi Ramen deserves it!!! Everything we ate was so flavorful and just plain yummy.....  The inside is new and clean with a modern casual decor.... I think it should be bigger cause once people try their food I imagine it'll be packed pretty often....  We ordered the small chicken curry over white rice and one taste of that yummy curry and we knew we were eating at a  I WILL BE BACK  type of restaurant....  The Chicken Karaage was so damn good!!! The breading was perfection and it was seasoned just right - accompanied by a small side of mixed greens with a yummy salad dressing - all this needed was a side of Fried Rice (which they don't have) and I would've been a happy camper!!!  Both small orders only cost $3.90 each - well worth the price if you ask me!!!  On to our Ramen - I had the  Fukumimi Ramen  which had the creamy pork based broth. On top of the soup was pork belly,bean sprouts,seasoned egg,and sea weed. The noodles were perfect - not too soft - more firm - This Ramen was delicious!!!!
