The BF had the  Tantan Men Ramen  which is a Szechuan style spicy soup with a chicken/pork based creamy broth that reminded us of a curry. In the Ramen was seasoned ground meat,bok choy and red chile oil. I tried the broth and it wasn't a taste that I would ever imagine at a Ramen place - it was so freakin yummy!!!!   There are add-ins to your Ramen for a minimal fee that you can get like corn ect...  You also get a stamp card where if you buy 4 ramens on your next visit you get either free gyoza or free chicken karaage. I'm not losing that stamp card...LOL  Now on 2 past occasions we tried to eat at Monta which is supposed to be like the Holy Grail in Vegas for Ramen but on each occasion it was too packed and we gave up but I honestly can't imagine any other Ramen places tasting better than what I ate tonight.....    So, I guess everyone should try Fukumimi Ramen before it becomes like a Monta :(

Reviews.Author: Mackenzie
Reviews.Content: I got a to-go order of tori ramen with corn and a side of gyoza. Everything was very hot, fresh, and very affordable. I have to say my favorite part was the gyoza because not only were they moist, but I got more than four. I've never been somewhere that gives more than 4 gyoza, and that alone makes me want to come back!

Reviews.Author: Julianne
Reviews.Content: I have never had traditional ramen and now I will never go back to the cups. The location is small and intimate but welcoming. You can't go wrong with any of the ramen.

Reviews.Author: Janet
Reviews.Content: Wait staff is very nice! Yummy tonkotsu broth and excellent melt in your mouth char siu!  Must order the karaage (Japanese fried chicken)!  Basically excellent ramen and what's even better you don't have to go to across town to Chinatown.

Reviews.Author: Tiff
Reviews.Content: Went here after work and was hungry! Their ramen definitely hit the spot. Super fast service and really really good for the price! Yummy in my tummy..just one tip for the server, don't take the bowl away without asking! I was eating from a different bowl, but definitely wasn't done with the rest of my delicious ramen

Reviews.Author: Omid
Reviews.Content: Awesome place!  Very small so expect a wait but it's well worth it.  I got the chicken based Ramen which was delicious! Although it only came with 3 slivers of chicken it was more than enough food.  I opted for extra egg which meant 3 total halves! I also got the spicy paste which didn't really add any heat to the broth but there was Sriracha available so I doctored it up.   The 2 unsung hero's however were the house salad, the sesame ginger house dressing was delicious, although it was just greens and dressing I could have eaten a pound of it! The other unexpected hero was the kimchi. The portion was small but it was quite possibly some of the best kimchi I've ever had.  So good I'm pretty sure it could convert a non kimchi liker into a lover!    Definitely coming back for some more Ramen and kimchi!

Reviews.Author: Ben
Reviews.Content: Small yet inviting ramen specialty restaurant. Handful of menu items that wouldn't take you more than 3 mins to choose from. Very flavorful and thick miso soup base. An ideal place for lunch.  I've eaten at countless ramen places including Japan, Korea, Asia, EU and handful of other states in US.  Bowl itself was small but deep. I immediately noticed that ingredients and noodles were drowned in soup when I got my ramen bowl. As I was working on my bowl, I felt disappointment that all noodles were gone with about 7 mouthful. Dont get me wrong, soup base is pretty good 4/5.  For price of average $8ish I felt that it wasn't enough to make me feel full or satisfied, Im a skinny guy. Ratio between ingredients and soup was 1:2.5. I found myself fishing for solids and spent twice longer trying to get myself full by drinking the soup. Extra ingredients were little pricey to add.   I would have loved it if the ratio was about 1:1.25. Little more generous portion of noodles and ingredients. I actually think that this business will do better if these things improve in the future.  Best wishes.

Reviews.Author: Coby
Reviews.Content: I come here all the time on lunch break. This is my favorite Ramen spot. Get the TanTan Men and extra chashu

Reviews.Author: Linda
Reviews.Content: I persuaded the BF to try this the other night.  He is a big fan of Japanese food, I not so much but I thought he might like it.  Turns out we both did!  I tried the karaage chicken appetizer and we both thought it was as everyone said earlier :KARAAAGE!!!! It is delicious, light, meaty, tasty, not greasy, and HOT.  He tried the tantan men and liked it but it was a little different than he's used to.  He wants to try the classic or tonkatsu next time.  I absolutely fell in love with the salad and the salad dressing was the best!!  The greens were delicate and tasty and the salad dressing, some tomato onion I'm not sure but it was delicious.  Service was quick and the seating comfortable enough.  We will definitely be back!!

Reviews.Author: Judy
Reviews.Content: I came here for the tan tan men. Sadly, I ordered to go so I did not have the availability of the chilis and oil, available at the restaurant.  It was soo heavenly! The flavor of the brother is so rich and complex with a nutty earthy flavor. My boyfriend loved it too! We will definitely be coming back. :)

Reviews.Author: Gan
Reviews.Content: We came here instead of Monta because my partner prefers Chicken and Monta doesn't serve chicken. Never been to Monta so I can't make a comparison.  The place is small but pretty nice. We ordered honey chicken and chicken rice bowl for my partner. I didn't eat the rice but the honey chicken Karaage is delicious. Tender in the inside, a bit crunchy outside.  The sauce is a bit tangy and has a good taste.  Now the main menu: noodle is pretty decent. Al dente - just how I like it. It has a good flavor but I taste better somewhere else. The broth is spicy and has a very strong smell. Do I mind? Nope cause it's delicious. The egg is okay. Nothing to writes home about. Now, the chasu!  That's a different story. I got extra and I am not sure how much they put without the extra. But man...it was plentiful in my bowl and soooooo good. It's the kind that melt in your mouth. Very tender and delicious. Will I come back? Definitely. Recommended? Definitely. For me, the chasu speaks for itself. Will be back if we ever visit this town again.   Update: 9/6/2015 Had to come back before going back to Houston. I like the noodle more after the second try. And the egg was actually tastier this time. Overall, highly recommended if you like spicy ramen.

Reviews.Author: Kiyo
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite ramen spots. I will say the only ramen worth getting is the tonkotsu shio ramen or the fukumimi ramen. The curry is also really good here

Reviews.Author: Nikkie
Reviews.Content: Staff are prompt. The food is absolutely delicious. My favorite is the curry rice and honey garlic chicken.

Reviews.Author: Alison
Reviews.Content: I recently came to Fukumimi with a friend who has been raving about it for a while. I must say I agree, the ramen in incredible! I tried the spicy tonkotsu ramen and thought it was fabulous. I think this might be my favorite ramen place, just because other places their broth seems so heavy from the pork. My ramen's broth was very flavorful without being overpowering. I also ordered a Sapporo, for $2.90 that's a steal!   The service is very nice and attentive, and the restaurant is small but clean. Big thumbs up! I will definitely be back soon! It's a great option if you are visiting the Aveda Institute.

Reviews.Author: Jon
Reviews.Content: very good ramen in a strip mall in vegas. the karaage chicken is like japanese fried chicken and is amazingly juicy. it's also amazingly hot when it hits the table so be careful; i burned my tongue a bit. the ramen itself was very good as was the broth. i wish i had a ramen place like this in my neighborhood.

Reviews.Author: Nadia
Reviews.Content: Today's visit was my first time here... I ordered the Tantan Men with the honey garlic chicken...I wasn't sure what the white stuff drizzled on top of the chicken was... When I found out it was mayonnaise I quickly told them not to put any (yuck). When the food came out, I was pleasantly surprised with how good and tender chicken was... I'll come back just for this dish alone. The ramen noodles were okay... The broth and spices were delish... I found myself ignoring the noodles and just drinking the broth. They charge extra if you want them to prepare it spicier than normal... They charge extra for just about everything (even water)...the service was okay, I was greeted when I walked in, everyone was nice... That's kind of where it stopped. I had to flag the waitress down each time I need something, I was never checked on during my meal. Overall, everything was pretty good. If I come back, it'll be to-go only...

Reviews.Author: Ceejey
Reviews.Content: My dinner experience with fukumimi was great!  There was no line, we were seated as soon as we enter. We ordered karaage, tonkotsu soy ramen and fukumimi ramen. All of it tasted just right and delicious. Karaage is like chicken filet, crunchy but juicy inside that came with a salad, love the dressing btw. Both ramen is delicious. Their broth cooked just right, not too rich and not too watery. Service was fast. The toilet is clean. They accept credit cards. Lots of parking space. Though a little expensive compare to the ramen resto in chinatown...But I highly recommend it for ramen lovers!

Reviews.Author: Sharlene
Reviews.Content: Placed a phone order for pick up. Ordered the karage and the spicy tonkotsu. The karage is by far the best I've had. Very flavorful and crisp even though I took it to go and it had been sitting out for awhile. But my friend said they left out the side of salt seasoning it should've came with but it was still delicious even without it. The tonkotsu was good too but I felt like the serving size was kinda smaller compared to if I had dined in and I felt like the toppings were kinda skimpy alsi. The broth was packed with flavor and the right amount of spiciness to it.

Reviews.Author: Cody
Reviews.Content: I ate here for dinner with my girlfriend. First of all, I'm not a ramen critic and I don't know what technically good ramen is. I just go by taste.   All I can say is: it wasn't bad. It wasn't the best ramen I've had, but I enjoyed what I was eating.   Taste: the broth was okay. Wasn't anything special. I had the tonkotsu ramen (salt). It was okay, didn't have a whole of flavor. My girlfriend has the tonkotsu ramen (spicy), she thought it was pretty spicy. I had a taste and I didn't think it was that spicy or had that much flavor.   Service: the staff were very friendly. Nothing to complain about.  Overall: I would say if you are in the area and want some ramen without having to drive far, then come here. If you want the best (in my opinion) go to Monta in Chinatown or Henderson.

Reviews.Author: Stacy
Reviews.Content: The car of miso ramen soup was delicious the honey glazed chicken appetizer was the best I love the atmosphere at this place its small and I'll continue on East Russell Road for one and a half miles for any casual dining experience hope this helps you choose this fabulous place

Reviews.Author: William
Reviews.Content: This place is right up there with the best ramen spots in Vegas. Believe me, I've tried almost every place Vegas has to offer for ramen, and I'm confident in saying that the broth here at Fukumimi is the best in town. It's exceptional!! Definitely a must-try stop for anyone in Vegas looking for ramen.

Reviews.Author: LeeRoy
Reviews.Content: This vegas ramen hit the spot. It's out of the Vegas strip but definitely taste better than a lot of on the strip foods  Prices are typical ramen spot prices. But this is one of my faves I have tried.  Worth the drive. Some wait. Delicious

Reviews.Author: Lily
Reviews.Content: Went there yesterday with my friend. Ordered 2 Ramens and 1 fried chicken. Wanted to try this place because of the rating, and we were very disappointed. The ramen tasted so bad, I know it because I have went to Japan for many times and this is nothing like what I've tried before. Secondly, the waitress seems to have attitudes, no water, no greeting...

Reviews.Author: Ted
Reviews.Content: Affordable authentic and delicious. Been here many times and the ramen is always delicious! Service is fast the place is clean. And they have a great selection of Japanese dishes for folks that are not so into ramen.

Reviews.Author: Joseph
Reviews.Content: Best ramen I've had, hands down. The atmosphere inside is very welcoming. The waitresses were very helpful with the menu. I got the fukimimi ramen because I enjoy a lot of toppings inside my ramen. I added a bunch of extra toppings like butter, sea weed, egg, corn, and chaschu (pork belly). The taste of their broth is very authentic and they take the time to make the bowl itself look beautiful upon arrival. I always put sauce in anything I eat, it's a habit.. This is probably one of the only places where I didn't need to add any extra sauces to it, which is really hard to do. This japanese ramen at its finest! Also had a large chaschu bowl which tasted amazing, their pork belly tasted great and the bowl itself complimented the ramen well. Only drawback is that this place is really small, I would call ahead to see what the wait time is. I don't recommend big parties here, keep it intimate when you decide to give this place a try!

Reviews.Author: R
Reviews.Content: The very first time I had a bad smelling ramen, the steaming broth smells like a dead pig. I still ate because I was hungry but as soon as I got a little bit of it, it wanted to come back out. It did not taste bad, just smells bad. Ewe, still grossing me out until now, will not come back.

Reviews.Author: LaVina
Reviews.Content: Maybe things taste better when you are sick. Ran into this place before catching my flight. Quick service! Sat at the bar and maybe 10 later - hello ramen! Yum yum  the broth was deep and creamy, pork belly always a plus and oddly, I liked the seaweed. Will definitely come again!

Reviews.Author: Jossy
Reviews.Content: Great place! I ordered the spicy ramen and usually other places say it's spicy and in reality its not at all! But this one without a doubt was SPICY and it was delicious!! The noodle was think, the spiciness was on point, the customer service was great, and the place is clean!!! I ordered it to go and they were pretty quick on giving me my order. Highly recommend trying it out! :)

Reviews.Author: Tiffster
Reviews.Content: Their broth is pretty good, just tell them you don't want it too salty, good service I'll come back

Reviews.Author: Darren
Reviews.Content: Lunch on Presidents Day. This is a great ramen spot on the east side of Las Vegas, only minutes from UNLV. We had the Gyozas for appetizer, which were delicious. I had the Kogashi Ramen. Flavored with an awesome fragrance of garlic  fried onions and small ramen noodles. Yum!!!!! Come down now and have a bowl of soup, you won't regret it.  The dining area isn't very big, if you don't count the 6 chairs at the bar area; so you might wait a few minutes to get a seat. But remember, LasVegasJapan Times.com rated this place better than Monta! This place also serves Miller and Sapporo alcohol.

Reviews.Author: Khawar
Reviews.Content: Very unassuming restaurant, in a deserted strip mall with lots of shady characters all around but that's what makes it fun. Food was pretty decent and service was good will be back.

Reviews.Author: Stefany
Reviews.Content: I fell in love with ramen when I lived in the Bay area last year, and so far of our slim pickings, Sora is the place I prefer. I found myself on the other side of town, and finally managed to fit in a trip to Fukumini, which is the third most-often-recommended place for ramen in Vegas (the second being Monta).  Despite the strip mall exterior, inside was small and cozy with bench seating and bar seating. I dined solo and was helped immediately. Staff was attentive. There is signage up advertising their limited-time summer special of cold noodles, as well as a new flavor of chicken: honey garlic, which sounded amazing but I was dining alone.  Ordered the tan tan men, for change of pace. Received a gigantic bowl of broth, bok choy, noodles, and sausage- the sausage was actually reminiscent of chorizo, full of fat and flavor and that distinctive orange tinge to the broth. The broth itself was super rich, and seems like it may have contained dairy. Noodles were chewy and thick, the way I like them. My only adjustment to this order in the future would be to add more bok choy- the three leaves in my dish simply were not enough to balance out the richness and fat in the sausage and broth. Overall flavor profile was complex, with spice from the sausage, and again, very rich.  Later, this richness caused some stomach problems for me- consider yourself warned. It's a tasty dish, with friendly service, but I'll probably stick with one of their more regular ramen dishes next- and try that chicken.

Reviews.Author: Celina
Reviews.Content: Fukumimi is my favorite ramen restaurant in Vegas so far. I get the Fukumimi Ramen which already comes with an 1/2 an egg! I don't have to order and pay more for the egg like at Monta. I also loveee the fact that the Fukumimi Ramen comes with an extra piece of Chashu pork which is just enough for me! The Chashu pork is super tender with not too much fat either. The soup base is very savory and noodles are cooked to perfection. Service is quick as well. What is there to not like about Fukumimi?!

Reviews.Author: Kijou
Reviews.Content: I was excited to try another Ramen spot in town.  With all the great reviews I was really excited.  We ordered the miso ramen and the spicy ramen.  I think the broth was excellent, but was not a fan of the noodles.  I thought they were very thin and boring.  Pork was tender but not the best i've had.  I thought the chicken karaage was very moist and tender.  Since this restaurant is not on my side of town...I don't know if I would go out of my way to eat here, but maybe if i was in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Author: Kimberly
Reviews.Content: This place is soo good! It's authentic what more else can you ask for?! Anyways despite the place being soo small it's very delicious! I had the Tonkatsa Ramen with a boiled egg! Ahhhhhh hits the spot! I also ordered the chicken karaage! Hands down  go ahead & try it out!

Reviews.Author: Vivian
Reviews.Content: While getting my phone screen replaced, we were looking for somewhere to eat. Everything sounded good so we just decided to go to fukumimi. BEST DECISION OF THE VEGAS TRIP! This place was so good and reasonably priced. For four people, we ordered the honey garlic chicken, 2 orders of soboro rice (1 was to go cause it was that good), curry rice, miso ramen, and tan tan men ramen. We were all stuffed and the total including a 15% tip was about 45-50 if I'm not mistaken. Will definitely be back.

Reviews.Author: Baby Breath
Reviews.Content: Ordered the soy ramen.  Did not taste the soy... I thought there was suppose to be soy milk in it? It's not bad but I've had better.  Waitress does not smile, kind of got an attitude.

Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: Excellent food. Always prepared perfectly whether it's take-out of eat in. Staff is friendly and efficient. My favourite spot for noodles.

Reviews.Author: M
Reviews.Content: Im not a big noodle person BUT I would go here again! Soup is amazing! Make sure to order extra noodles. The chicken is so yummy! Looking forward to our next visit!

Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: I hesitate to tell anyone about this hidden gem, because I don't want it to get any busier! This place is delicious...we had the honey garlic chicken, curry, and ramen. Broth is full of flavor, noodles and char siu tender. Amazing food, we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: After a tip from my fellow nihonshoku reviewer, I went there on my scouting trip.   The ramen here is interesting in that it is tonkotsu based yet have options of different flavors such as miso, shio, etc, but not plain tonkotsu.  They also have tan tan men but it was sold out so I went for spicy tonkotsu and my daughter tried tonkotsu miso along with a side of karaage.    Tonkotsu spicy was fantastic.   You can definitely taste the rich tonkotsu base but the spicy miso with which it is flavored with added a thick kotteri flavor full of umami.   Excellently executed.   Tonkotsu miso was closer to tonkotsu than a miso ramen in my opinion and it was very good, probably better than monta.   As this is more of a tonkotsu place, it should not be compared to Sora.   Chicken karaage was perfectly done with a slice if lemon, flavored salt into which you can dip the chicken and a small salad.    My only complaint is that I didn't get to taste the tan tan men and that it's on the East side far away from my house.  I would rate their tonkotsu higher than that of montas as I have noticed some inconsistencies in monta recently.  For pure miso ramen I take Sora all day with their thick curly noodles.

Reviews.Author: Thomas
Reviews.Content: Really good ramen--not the best one I've had but quite good. Try their special Fukumimi ramen.

Reviews.Author: Wes
Reviews.Content: We've been to this place a few times and came to the realization that this place is.. ok. Its not the amazing ramen you get from a place like Sora, and its not a runner up to a place like Monta.. But you do get good service and the food is not terrible. The Honey garlic chicken is delicious, the ramen isnt amazing.. but its not bad, and the gyoza is perfect. The service is really good and the staff is very friendly and attentive.

Reviews.Author: Aaron
Reviews.Content: Very reasonably priced and tasty!   Always packed which is a good thing!

Reviews.Author: Theresa
Reviews.Content: Second time was even better than the first! The pork belly consistency and flavor is now similar to monta and the shio tonkatsu broth is light and not overly salty. The karaage is not my favorite since it was slightly oily and not crisp on the outside.  However you can't really beat the value for the portion they give you and it comes with a small side salad.  I wish they had put the dressing on the side since some of it caused the karaage to get soggy.  Overall solid establishment and 4 ramen purchases gets you a free appetizer...so make sure to get the punch card.

Reviews.Author: Melanie
Reviews.Content: The best ramen I've ever had - hands down.  I'm not a big pork eater (haven't eaten red meat since 1986) - so I was happy to see that Fukumimi has a Chicken Ramen on the menu.  My first experience with restaurant ramen was in Little Tokyo in L.A. and lemme tell ya - Fukumimi blew that L.A. ramen out of the water.    Fukumimi's broth was dense in flavor and the Chicken Chashu included in the bowl was well-spiced, flavorful and mind-blowing. Easily one of the best food experiences I've had in Vegas. Dangerously close to work - I asked for their punch card.  I expect I'll be earning a free appetizer a week!

Reviews.Author: Ife
Reviews.Content: Up there with Ramen Sora, Fukumimi is my other favorite ramen spot in town.   Just like at Sora, I always have the usual, the Fukumimi. It comes with all the nessescary essentials: pork, miso broth, thin noodles, nori, green onion, egg... But as an added bounus, you get their yummy black garlic oil poured on top.  I have tried the Tan Tan Men as well. I really, really think that you should order it, at least once. It's not everyone's cup of tea (right Khatherine T.? Heh heh), but when I tried it, I have to say it was a nice change of pace.  The minced pork is almost sweet, with the broth being quite even and mellow. There almost seems to be slight nutty flavor to it. It's nice to break away from the usual once in a while.  One of the awesome things about Fukumimi is their rewards card! It only takes 4 stamps to earn either a free karage chicken or gyoza on your next trip! So it really doesn't take a million trips over there to earn it, unlike some places where you have to buy 10 or 15 of something to earn some small reward.  There's not much room inside, so it can get crowded fast. Most of the time, it's not, so don't worry. They should look into serving a bigger selection of adult libations. You can only order a few beers and (I think) sake. There's such a high profit margin to be made an alcohol, I don't see the harm in trying it out.   This is a little Vegas gem. Make a special trip!

Reviews.Author: Manny
Reviews.Content: The tonkotsu broth was excellen--100x better than Monta or Sora.  What ruined it for me was the negi that looked like it had been cut with a spoon (green onion aloe anyone?) and the pork belly chasu.  Some  ramen people  are all about the broth or the noodles.  I'm a chasu guy.  The chasu was dry and chewy--like soaking a paper towel in the broth and eating it.  I think there were 3 pieces and I muscled my way through the 1st and could not eat the other 2 even though I was still hungry.  Staff was friendly but the waitress never checked up on us after taking the order (the cook dropped the food off).

Reviews.Author: Hiro
Reviews.Content: Kogashi Ramen $8.20. Which is rousted garlic with tonkotsu soup.  I loved it!  I forgot to bring stamp card to get free meal.  Lol  My husband had Karaage and Gyoza.  These were great.

Reviews.Author: Laurie
Reviews.Content: My daughter found this place on the web. She spent some time in Japan and tries to share that with me by finding these cute little places that are authentic and close by. This place has off the chart ratings and with good cause! The staff is friendly and helpful. The food is yummy and she tells me it is much like a place in Japan would be. I won't be visiting Japan any time soon however she tells me this is an authentic place. we will return soon

Reviews.Author: Tommy
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed this ramen bowl of goodness for sure. You would never think that on the eastside part of Las Vegas that they would be putting out a great ramen dish. I've been to ramen sora, Monta and other ramen places but I think when it comes to noodles and broth this is my favorite flavor IMO. It's a perfect portion as well and I didn't feel overly stuffed. Only thing was maybe the pork cha-Su could use some work.

Reviews.Author: Nicole
Reviews.Content: My husband did not enjoy the spicy ramen. Maybe had three small pieces of pork. I thought the miso ramen was alright. We also had the chasu bowl. The pork was sweet and there was very little in the bowl. Won't be trying that again.  Monta ramen it still Las Vegas's best ramen!

Reviews.Author: Eric
Reviews.Content: Really yummy... a nice surprise to find in a strip mall in Vegas. Very umami flavors, super friendly service, a cute little authentic ramen-house vibe. It's the real deal and a SUPER filling meal for under $10!

Reviews.Author: Piss
Reviews.Content: The tonkotsu was amazing! so delicious two thumps up i would recommend it  :)

Reviews.Author: Keith
Reviews.Content: I am in love with this restraunt, its perfect. Fantastic customer service and more than amazing food. I get the tan tan men and love it every single time, it is super rich and flavorful. There karage is my favorite type of fried chicken in the world. There kimchi here is also my favorite kimchi ever.

Reviews.Author: Tammy
Reviews.Content: THANK YOU, GPS, for screwing up and sending us in circles around this ramen restaurant!!  When we finally found Fukumimi, we were a little skeptical because it didn't look like much from the outside.  It was located in a nondescript seemingly vacant strip mall.  The exterior of the restaurant boasted no more than their restaurant name and a lit  OPEN   sign, betraying what we were to soon find out their cozy, modern inside.  The decor was spartan chic in a way that only Japanese can be.  As expected, the menu was fairly limited.  Unlike other places, they offer only rice bowls...no fried rice (I do enjoy Japanese-style fried rice).  Up until this point, the aroma of the restaurant did a lot to convince me that the ramen may be legit.  But I still needed more...so I ordered the purist's favorite tonkotsu ramen.  Hubby went with the Fukumimi special which from what I can gather is just a supersized version of their regular tonkotsu ramen.  We also ordered the recommended karaage as well as a small chicken bowl.  Chicken bowl - comforting, pretty decent, well-flavored Karaage - BEST I've ever had.  Moist, lightly battered and tender...served with a mini salad and some special salt / lemon wedge Ramen - The broth was excellent.  Rich without being overwhelming and definitely well-seasoned and flavored.  The garlic oil was a great addition and the egg (of which I ordered extra) was perfectly cooked in that the yolk was jelly-like instead of yellow and chalky.  Service was nice, very friendly...though I don't know why but the ramen chefs seemed to be talking about me, somewhat disconcerting until I got distracted by the food.  (I swear, I'm not vain...but they could probably tell we were out-of-towners.  A quick scan of the cars parked outside seem to yield that everyone in the joint is from NV.)  Definitely a must-visit...the wait wasn't as ridiculous as the other highly-touted ramen place.  Hopefully one day they will see fit to add fried rice to their repertoire of dishes.

Reviews.Author: Jenny
Reviews.Content: I believe in Las Vegas, this ramen place is as good as it gets (especially since Kai Gen Ro is no more). I had the   Fukumimi Ramen: the broth is milky, not as milky as Ippudo in NY, but still really milk of bone milky, not cream milky. The noodles are very similar to a thin egg noodle I used to get from a company called Quon Yick, but although they are similar these noodles are definitely very tasty and cooked perfectly. They are not overcooked and the color is slightly translucent but still opaque enough that you can tell they are done with care. Seaweed is the normal nori that you would find in large sheets cut up into squares. Their chashu is pork belly slow-braised and sliced thin, seasoned well and not overly salty.   You can get kaedama (another mouthful of noodles) for $1. It's not on the menu, but you can request it. It comes in a little rice bowl and is less than the amount at Monta, but Monta charges $2 for their kaedama.  I also tried their  Curry Rice Bowl: their rice bowls come in small or large. The curry was okay, but I'm not as big a fan of Japanese curry as I am of Thai or Indian curry. The ginger was somewhat special to me because I noticed they took the time to include pickled turnip which was also red. It's interesting because normally the red pickled ginger is only ginger, so it was a nice little surprise.   Their front of house staff mainly speaks Japanese, but understood enough English to take my order. The interior is mainly decorated in wood, very simple yet chic. It speaks and says, we're here for you to eat and enjoy a moment of zen. I enjoyed my moment. It's also more spacious and they don't try to turn and burn, like at some other places... eh hem.   They cleared away dishes discreetly and added water appropriately. Their service was apparent, but not brash. I also forgot my sunglasses and they chased after me to return them. From start to finish, I enjoyed my meal very much.

Reviews.Author: Thracius
Reviews.Content: delicious ramen, maybe the best in vegas. rich broth and above average noodles. curry rice is good, too.   place is small, so be prepared to wait if you go during between 6 and 8 pm-ish.

Reviews.Author: Terri
Reviews.Content: I consulted the local ramen expert, Tetsuro P., before coming back to Fukumimi a second time.  The first time I didn't know the difference between this place and Ramen Sora or Monta.  I learned that the curly noodles at those two places are actually Sapporo style ramen and Fukumimi is Osaka style (I think that's right).  That explains why Fukumimi's noodles are different, being straight and thinner.  Upon Tetsuro-san's recommendation, I ordered the Tonkotsu-Miso fusion ramen and it was definitely a delicious choice.  Knowledge is power!  Ultimately, I prefer the Sora Sapporo style noodles, but the broth at Fukumimi is better--let's fuse those!  Domo arigato to Tetsuro for schooling me.   Also, this second trip to Fukumimi was Elizabeth B.'s first UYE.  It was a fabulous evening with: (roll call)  her, Joe L., Mel C., Chad S., Alicia R., Francisco A., Ian A., and Shirley B.  Fun times at Fukumimi!  The end.

Reviews.Author: Beverly
Reviews.Content: Yup! The reviews here are LEGIT!  Forget Monta, Fukumimi is now my 'go to' place if I ever want ramen off the strip!  The chaysu here is one of the best I've had!  It's has plenty of meat and more meat than fat... mmm YUM!  .. and it was perfectly cut too!  Not too think, and not too thin.  The broth is good too, but I've had better.  It just wasn't as rich as I hoped it would be.  The noodles were GOOD and the egg was soft-boiled just the way it should be.  The karaage is breaded and fried just right, I LOVED it!  .. and they say you eat with your eyes first right?  Well, I have to say the ramen here is definitely one of the prettiest I've seen yet!    FYI - the fukumimi ramen is the same as their tonkotsu but has more pieces of chaysu and seaweed. .. and get a punch card!

Reviews.Author: Jenn
Reviews.Content: Flavorful Tonkotsu Ramen (salt) and Fukumimi Ramen (extra pork). It is one of the best ramen joints in Vegas. The karrage sprinkled with lemon and a side of white rice is additional happiness to my appetite. But to complete the experience is to enjoy it with a bottle of Sapporo. Prices are amazing    Customer service was awesome and polite. Got all what was asked and gave help suggestions as to what to order if stuck between choices.

Reviews.Author: Debbie
Reviews.Content: It's a small and intimate spot and I love the wood walls! Service was efficient and friendly. Food came out fast too.   I ordered the tan tan noodle which was their spicy pork in thicker broth. The broth was thicker because of the sesame paste and the taste was ok. I don't think I am a fan of sesame paste but at least I can say I've tried it. Also, the dish was not spicy.

Reviews.Author: Manny
Reviews.Content: When you're in the mood for some ramen this is the place.  The miso ramen is great don't forget the appetizers.

Reviews.Author: Charmaine
Reviews.Content: The best Ramen and kimchi hands on!!! I don't go anywhere else for a craving. I always order their fukumimi Ramen with extra corn and egg, and my hubby always have spicy miso Ramen. For our appetizer kimchi kimchi kimchi! Oh also don't miss to try their sobodo bowl!

Reviews.Author: Candace
Reviews.Content: The Skinny: props for using proper Tonkotsu ramen noodles however the flavour of the broth just ain't up the snuff. Their karaage on the other hand is a good portion size and pretty tasty (3) Service: they messed up our order but it turned out okay because we were too full anyway (2) overall: the tonkotsu ramen broth is still subpar but at least decent, toppings are okay and reasonably priced. Wouldn't go out of my way to eat here but if I was in the neighbourhood and having pregnancy-like cravings for ramen, I'd give this place another shot.(3)  Found out about this place and headed over for nice big bowl of Japanese lovin'.  We ordered a tonkotsu miso ramen ($8.20), fukumimi ramen($9.50), karaage ($3.90) and a curry bowl ($3.90).   Here is my analysis of the ramen:  The Broth: meh - not enough porky fatty goodness in the broth - on the oink scale, this would rank about a 6/10 scale - detectable but definitely not enough.  The Noodles - kudos for the actual legit tonkotsu noodles (the straight, white noodles). Mildly overdone (I prefer a little more firmness) but definitely gets some marks for this.  Miscellaneous: Chashu - it's okay - not your melt-in-your mouth goodness but decent enough. Egg - good amount of runniness - perfectly cooked. Toppings amount - decent amount given the price.  The karaage was pretty good - nice crispness without too much coating and well seasoned. Very good portion size for the price too. Overall, I think I enjoyed the karaage better than the ramen actually.  We never received our curry bowl (the server forgot to put the order in) but that was okay because we were fairly stuffed after finishing our ramen and karaage.   To me, what differentiates the true great from a decent ramen place is the broth -- and Fukumimi Ramen definitely wasn't  lickin' the bowl clean  kinda good for me. It lacked the soulful perfection from a great ramen joint. That being said, it's okay enough to fill the belly and the karaage was pretty good. For that, it gets a 3 starred review.

Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: I come here at least twice a month. It hits the spot every time! Service is good and the food is wonderful. Nuff said.

Reviews.Author: Alexandria
Reviews.Content: Visiting for EDC. Found this place for my friend who has a selfish allergy and my hunger for real ramen. No disappointment and reasonable prices.

Reviews.Author: Misti
Reviews.Content: A must stop on your Vegas ramen tour! We went late one Friday afternoon, and the spot was empty. I love the wooden interior; it feels clean and like you're entering a quiet little place outside of the Vegas bustle.   The service was smiley, which is always appreciated. After perusing the short menu, my husband asked for a recommendation, and the waitress actually said she liked the chicken ramen, which is a unique offering. He went with her lead and enjoyed it.  I went for my standard ramen order which is miso. I was pleased to know that they don't include bamboo shoots, so I didn't have to ask them to hold 'em. When the bowl hit the table, the only slightly disappointing aspect was the size. It seemed a bit smaller than other ramen bowls. However, it still delivered a big flavor, including corn niblets and  bean sprouts! The noodles had the right chewiness, and the broth was a savory treat. The pork belly could have been a bit more luscious, but overall, it was a ramen experience worth repeating.

Reviews.Author: Danielle
Reviews.Content: It was just ok. Quick service, nice ambience, decent prices.  I ordered the traditional ramen as it was new on the menu, but it lacked seasoning. Large portion of noodles and broth, but I wish there were some depth to the broth. I'll be back to try a different dish just to make sure I didn't misjudge this place. Until then, three stars it is.

Reviews.Author: Marianne
Reviews.Content: It failed to disappoint me the second time! It's a small place so the wait time is not that long.. get their Ramen card so you get a free appetizer for every 4 ramen bought! Tryin the curry rice it's sooo good!

Reviews.Author: Ren
Reviews.Content: Love this place- I crave the miso soup- so glad that we moved close by AND that they have a punch card.

Reviews.Author: Jenny
Reviews.Content: I am a huge Ramen person, and this place hit the spot. Great portions and it was very tasty. I'm not from Vegas, so trying different ramen places around, this was really good. It was on the opposite side of town where I was staying but it was worth the drive. Very flavorful.

Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: The best ramen in the city.  This is exactly what a ramen place is meant to be: a small menu whose broths and noodles are executed perfectly, fresh ingredients, reasonable price, and a simple but nice looking dining room.  I've most often gotten the fukumimi ramen. It's a bowl with extra pork--delicious, delicious pork. I'd give any bowl in this place a shot, though.

Reviews.Author: Brenda
Reviews.Content: In my craving for ramen, we decided to come here due to all of the Yelpers rave reviews. Thank you Yelpers.   The verdict: We ordered the miso ramen and the tonkatsu ramen. Overall, it was just ok. It was decent ramen in a bowl, but I just didn't think it was THE BEST ramen ever that I needed to go back to a billion times over.  Broth was flavorful enough, but it was just lacking some sort of umph! I can't put my finger on what exactly was missing though.   We had actually ordered extra noodles just because we knew it wasn't going to be enough noodles and I'm always a hungry hippo. For me it's about the quantity and quality.  It is a little bit on the pricey side, but if your in a rush, around this area and don't want to wait this will be a decent ramen place for you to try.

Reviews.Author: Lindsey
Reviews.Content: This place is AMAZING! I had never had this cuisine before and we tried it on a whim recently (it is in our neighborhood and we wanted to try something new). I have been back 5 times in less than 2 months.   The food was awesome, the staff is helpful and nice. I like the bar setup also because I can go in during lunchtime by myself and read my book. Love this place!

Reviews.Author: Ami
Reviews.Content: It's very hard to earn above 3 stars from me. But here it is! I lobe ramen and have been to many. Most are hit or miss But Fukumimi has consistently satisfied my appetite for ramen. Their karaage chicken is a great appetizer especially for children with less grease than expected and just the right amount Of salt. My favorite would be the spicy miso with thick noodles. Subtle flavors at first and satisfyingly bold after. Highly recommend if you're in the area and looking for a great ramen place. Staff is very helpful, courteous and patient so an extra star for that. Prices and portions are a hit too. Two thumbs up!

Reviews.Author: Winnie
Reviews.Content: Definitely the best raven I've ever had in the U.S. The soup is extremely rich and has so much flavor. Highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Author: Catherine
Reviews.Content: Had a late dinner at the bar in the middle of the week.  I was greeted by friendly staff and order was taken as soon as I was seated.  Ordered the Fukumimi Ramen and chicken Karage.  The karage was crispy on outside, but juicy on inside.  The salad that came with karage had a tangy citrus dressing.  Ramen was perfect on a cold night, not overly salty like other joints I've been too where broth usually is.  Atmosphere was nice, but busy with the tables filled so must mean business is good.  It's a great getaway for ramen that is away from Chinatown if you are on east side of town.

Reviews.Author: Selena
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I was attracted there because his co-worker strongly recommend this place.so we went to try it one late night.the place is a kind of tiny like home kitchen,but the atmosphere is good ,almost full of customer.we felt a little bit surprise about its good business,but after we tried one bowl of house special ramen and ask for another one,we figure out the reason.the food was so tasty and the soup base made me feel amazing.the only regret is after meal I felt a little bit thirsty maybe they put some MSG,or maybe the soup base is salty.another thing is the price is a little bit higher than we've tried like sora ramen,monta ramen.almost 10bucks for just noodles with few chashu pork,pricy for me.  So you can try once a week as a change of appetite but not for everyday meal.

Reviews.Author: Kate
Reviews.Content: Comfort food!  Nothing better when you're not feeling well than a big bowl of noodles and yummy broth!  Even the picky eater will eat noodles!    Small small place, but they are so friendly and the good is really good.    We all tried something different and they were all delicious.

Reviews.Author: Jaime
Reviews.Content: Yo, Vegas has a ramen joint. TELL EVERYONE.  My favorite being tan tan men, I ordered that and the kaarage (small bites of fried chicken). My friend ordered the Fukumimi ramen, which I believe is a pork-based broth.  The tan tan men was too creamy. Like, grainy creamy. The interaction of miso with the liquid broth was not there. In fact, I barely ate any of mine because of it. Soooo why give this place four stars?  Their Fukumimi ramen was awesome. It had an amazing flavor that I will most certainly order in the future. I'm having a hard time describing it, just, whatever, just go. Kaarage is good too, but I'd personally stick to the ramen.  So sayth our Lord and Savior, Flying Spaghetti Monster.  R-aaaamen.

Reviews.Author: Andres
Reviews.Content: This is probably my favorite ramen join in the US. I love the fact that the base for everything is tonkotsu, and I love all the awesome variations on it. On my last visit this July in Vegas, I tried the spicy miso tonkotsu and it was hands down one of the best bowls of ramen I've ever had. Paired with their excellent appetizers and great service, this is a place that I visit every time that I go to Vegas, and I plan on visiting it again next year!

Reviews.Author: Mel
Reviews.Content: Kara Miso is the way to go on a rainy day! Service is great. Food is great. Garlic Chicken is the bomb.

Reviews.Author: Sylmar
Reviews.Content: The food is okay. The ladies that work here have an attitude. Otherwise, the place is alright.

Reviews.Author: Walter
Reviews.Content: Since my first trip to Fukumimi Ramen over a year ago, I have been going a couple times a month for lunch.  The food continues to be wonderful, and the service is always prompt.  It's a great place to eat when you're right on time for lunch - they can get you in and out pretty fast.  Love this place!

Reviews.Author: Davoud
Reviews.Content: This may just be the East Coast talking, but I've not had better ramen than this before. I had a hankering for. Ramen because I've got the sniffles and was in Las Vegas for work. A quick Yelp search and flat tire later, I finally found them. The guy behind the counter was gracefully trying to remove a belligerent vagrant as I entered the place. He could have been mean, as she was swearing up a storm, but he was calm and kind, which really made a good impression on me.   But vagrant relations was not the purpose of my visit, so on to the food!  I had the karaage (Japanese fried chicken bits - $3.90) and tantan men (pork, miso, and sesame paste ramen $8.95). Both were superb, and the price was right.   My craving satisfied and with no angry homeless people blocking my exit, I left a happy customer.

Reviews.Author: Suzanne
Reviews.Content: Honestly not a big fan of this place. I ordered the tonkatsu ramen and didn't think it was particularly special or even that good. The broth has good flavor but it wasn't super thick or rich. I think the main culprit were the noodles.  It was pretty bland and didn't add much to the meal besides my carb load count. There was also very little cha Siu meat that comes with the ramen.   I haven't had a lot of ramen in vegas but I definitely don't think I'll be coming back to this one. Service was great, the place was small and cozy, but I left pretty unsatisfied with my meal.

Reviews.Author: Sheryle
Reviews.Content: Small little place but the food is good! Small size but will fill you up and with a good price you can get 2. The ramen bowls are a good size for a person to get filled up on. It's the little appetizers that are small. Everything we ordered was good. The only thing that I have to dock them on was the water! We all had white floating things in our water, they said it's from the ice. Either way it's gross. Even after replacing it we still saw floaties, we got pop instead.

Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: Probably one of the best Ramen places in Vegas. A little small but excellent service.  Spicy miso is a winner!!

Reviews.Author: Wendy
Reviews.Content: It was 5 ish late Saturday afternoon, and the cold was really setting in.  A hearty bowl of ramen was definitely the right call.  Hubby ordered TanTan Men.  He scoffed it down, and raved about it.  I had the Fukumimi ramen.  Really liked it, but could have cared less for the 3 large sheets of nori.  It already had seaweed oil, but I suppose it is a personal preference.  The chashu was delicious.  The bean sprouts could be cooked less, I like mine just blanched... my only real complaint.    Our table (by the entrance) was wobbly, and so was my chair.  Figured there was a slope on the concrete floor.  Hubby broke a ohashi to correct the wobbliness, so table now no longer wobbles, just on slight angle with the floor So if you happen to sit by the window table, and notice the slant, that's my hubby's 'workmanship':)     Yuki, our server, presented us with a 'stamp' card... eat 4 bowls=choice of free karaage or gyoza.   Novel idea. Per Yuki's recommendation, we will definitely to try the karaage.  She claims that it's better than KFC.   Will definitely return.  Be warned though, restaurant is narrow, and with limited seating, like Monta.  At that time, all the tables were already filled... and they had a steady stream of patrons... mostly Japanese.  Good sign. :)

Reviews.Author: LJ
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a very good new ramen place try, go to Fukumimi Ramen. I ordered the Fukumimi Ramen no joke it was the best ramen I've ever had. One sip of the broth and I was hooked. There are definitely so many amazing flavors going into it. Some suggestions I would give is to enjoy the broth before diving into the noodles, up to you though I like my noodles a little less firm they're still good. The pork belly was very delicious, let it soak into the broth you're gonna love it more. Nori pieces complemented it all. I wish I had more.  Fukumimi Ramen isn't that hard to find. It's not that far from the university, airport, strip, and a lot of business areas. It's located in a center on the NE corner of Tropicana and Eastern and just stands out with its funky Fukumimi Ramen sign and red banners in the window. It is however small inside and apparently people don't know how to park outside but there are a lot of parking.  I'm no ramen expert and haven't been to many  authentic  Japanese ramen places but Fukumimi Ramen has to be one of the better new ramen places to try. As I said it is small and new, right now is the best time to go before it gets more popular. There's probably only 5 tables and the bar area seats maybe about 5.   I've heard of their tantanmen, so you're next my list tantanmen I'm coming for you.

Reviews.Author: Kristin
Reviews.Content: Horrible service we came in when it wasn't that busy and none of the waitress offered to sit us down when they had plenty of openings. We asked for Sprite and Coke and got water I didn't want corn or egg and got that we had to keep calling are waitress she wouldn't come to us.people next to us were waiting for water and they had to aspirate and got their food before they even got the water so it's a girl couple of minutes for her to give them the water after they had already gotten their food. SUCKS I HATED THIS PLACE

Reviews.Author: Katie
Reviews.Content: Is a great ramen place here, love the Japanese style tantan noodles. The soup was very different and tasty although a bit too salty. The best was their Fukumimi ramen, the soup as GREAT, the pork was tender and the noodles was done just right. Iwould say is wayyy better than Monta.

Reviews.Author: Luc
Reviews.Content: I always get the tonkotsu ramen here. It's okay. The tonkotsu at Monta Ramen is richer and more delicious, though. The kaarage is amazing. Try it.

Reviews.Author: Krista
Reviews.Content: After reading a few reviews, I was very excited to try this ramen place on our way back to LA. Arriving sometime in the early afternoon, our group of 7 people were immediately seated in the back.   The waitress was very nice and the rest of the staff also seemed very friendly. However, I was less than impressed with the food.   Gyoza: So many people raved about these dumplings in the reviews, I thought it was a must try thing. In my personal opinion, the gyoza was less appetizing than the frozen pot stickers I can purchase from Costco.  Mini Chashiu Bowl: I do not think the meat that topped the rice could even be called meat...let alone pork. The rice also tasted a bit over cooked (soggy).   Ramen: The broth is good, but nothing worth travelling to. The noodles were mediocre and the only really great thing to rave about in this bowl was the soft boiled egg, and i think it's harder to mess up an egg than it is to make it delicious!   If you are really close by and there's nothing else you really want, then coming here is OK. But if you are on the fence, I would maybe try for another place. There really wasn't anything that stood out to me here.

Reviews.Author: Garo
Reviews.Content: My first search for Ramen in LV w/ a filter of one $ led me here. Wow. This was phenomenal and rather than me ask what the top customer choices were at their place, they had signs up everywhere with a Top 3 list of ramen ordered. I ended up having the extra garlic oil one (forgot the name, writing this review late) and an unsweetened green tea, PERFECTION. Definitely coming back, great food!

Reviews.Author: Anthony
Reviews.Content: Great ramen. I live super close to here and I've gone five times in the last month. I love the service but the food is what keeps me going back.

Reviews.Author: Tk
Reviews.Content: WOW, best tantanmen and karaage in town!! small little place in a old plaza, next to baskin N robbins ice cream place. Real authentic japanese ramen is found here. Price is fair and food is obliviously good. I try to come here every week but its a little far distance from my place, but if it was close by, I would be heading there every DAY!!!!

Reviews.Author: Sandy
Reviews.Content: How do I describe my Fukumimi experience? SILENCE. And lots of it.   When you're on a first date, this is probably not the first red flag that you need to run to the bathroom and call your BFF to call you back in 10 minutes with an emergency to bail you out.  Mayday! The night is going downhill stat! MAYDAY!    But if you were like me and brought a parent whose seen more than his share of bowls of ramen in his lifetime, then the silence is welcomed. It's a stamp of approval. A gold star. It means that the bowl of miso tonkotsu ramen my dad ordered and the bowl of salt tonkotsu ramen I got delivered on generous portions of noodles, aromatic broth, and some righteous slices of chashu pork.   The service is here is quick and to the point, but not brusque or overbearing at all. They didn't ask us if we knew about their punch card, so I approached them after having perused a few reviews on Yelp, and now I'm two out of four bowls of ramen away from a free side of gyoza or chicken karaage. What a great day.  Sidenote - I had to drop my dad, said Senor Silence, off at the airport after our meal and we made it with more extra time than we anticipated. So an even better day.
